And behaviour like that is becoming hella common, and also more ridiculous, and in the former example, actively harmful to Syrian bloggers. While the move away from online anonymity worries me, what's sad is how people are using social networking to portray themselves as things they are not. This isn't a case of repeating something until it's true either, because these blogs offer spheres of positive affirmation, allowing people to convince themselves that they somehow are the person they describe in their blog, rather than say a Ohioan adopting his wife's identity and pretending to be a lesbian, or a self-important blogger pretending to be respected and successful with his preferred sex. It is often the first advice proffered on self-improvement threads on Reddit and 4chan, and it is true that if you pretend to be something enough, you will eventually become it, but with these fictional personas, it's not the case. It simply exacerbates one's negative qualities, like say an inability to handle criticism, and turns them into virtues.

In the real world one would either have to acknowledge or refute any critiques of their behaviour, but in the blogosphere, they don't have to. They can screen their comments so visitors only see praise and affirmation (the blogger who sparked this post), or not allow comments at all, in case people are able to skewer them in ways not everyone will get (any number of conservative youtubers, like Wolverines, a horrible "rap" group. Read the top comment on that video, and then listen to the diss, by the excellent Satellite High, to get an example of the kind of behaviour I'm talking about. Wolverines don't allow Made You Look Stupid to become an official response, and can then complain about being victimized by liberals, safe in the knowledge that they don't have to risk people hearing the diss and realising what a bunch of tools they are). Honestly this kind of sheltered life, carefully censoring criticism (in both of the examples (I ethered the Rumpravished, and the beautiful carnage is posted above, I would say that it's pretty hard to fault the critiques, perhaps they maybe get personal, but those are the terms the bloggers and the youtubers set, and those are the terms on which they were destroyed), and cherry-picking from any negative responses to portray yourself as a noble, victimised man speaking truth to power and getting hated by prejudiced individuals because YOU'RE JUST EXPRESSING OPINIONS, and even if those opinions are ignorant, bigoted, and demonstably wrong, then criticism amounts to attempts at censorship (double points if the post which sparked everything recommends censorship as a way of upholding moral order). It's fucking pathetic.

Also, I'm gonna drop the sign-off. It was just a way of avoiding having to write structured conclusions to my shit.

entry.title: The internet is without an erase tool: An ode to defunct blogs for which I hold great affection
Bounce Up Like Roundball
entry.content:
It's been just over 2 months since I last posted on here. A lot of things have happened. I've taken exams. I've read blogs. Stupid blogs. Smart blogs. I've seen good blogs fall victim to self-importance and wrong-headedness, and great blogs see their content stream reduced to a trickle. I've read blogs that may well have been stupid, but since they were written by illiterates, I couldn't tell. I've read stupid blogs by people who think themselves smart. I've had a quick look at about three quarters of all blogs by Blogspot users listing their location as Dundalk, Louth, Ireland. About 6 had a significant amount of content, and of those 6, 2 were readable. You can look forward to a quick rundown of the high- and low-lights of the Dundalk blogging scene later this summer. There are very few highlights.

Other things happened too, Miami Heat fans became even more ignorant and insufferable; Russell Westbrook became hated; Phil Jackson got swept for the first time as a coach, and the second time total (his last season with the Knicks ended with them being swept by the Sixers); the Cavs apparently decided the top two picks in a weak draft were something worth having; J.R. Smith got some kind of traffic charge while on his scooter, and TMZ decided to make it a race thing; Yes it has been an exciting playoffs/offseason in the NBA. Momentous sea-changing events everywhere. But not just in basketball has this been the case. A brief rundown of things I thought worth comment during the hiatus, sorted randomly, rather than by some rational metric, like time of occurrence, or relative importance:


  • Lauren Faust left her position on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, which has been the biggest and most pleasant surprise of the last 12 months in television. It's probably not going to affect the quality that much, since she only actually wrote a handful of elements, and will still be involved in Season 2 in an advisory capacity. Still, it is a shame. I'd worry about merchandising influencing the show's direction, but the merchandise for MLP:FiM and the show itself exist in entirely different space-time continua, so it's not really a concern.
  • The Playstation Network went down in mid-late April, and it's still not fully functioning. EA have jumped the gun and put up announcements regarding new items available in the Store, including a "Welcome Back" event regarding FIFA 11's Ultimate Team mode.
  • HMV tried really hard to rid themselves of all copies of Shogun 2: Total War. Their last copy was priced at €18 as of yesterday (for comparison, €50 on Steam, €30 on Amazon.co.uk).
  • A year living with a fervent racist has given me a heightened awareness of casual racism. Mostly I find this newly-noticed casual racism hilarious. My favourite example was a guy a couple of years back saying he disliked Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas because he found the concept of a man from the "hood" (the quotation marks were his own) owning a casino far too unrealistic. Incidentally, there is one black casino owner in the U.S., hailing from Detroit (no doubt the individual who made the comment would consider any predominately black area to be a "hood").
  • Conservative media outlets kicked up a massive fuss over Common (you know, from the Queen Latifah movies and the Gap ads) being invited to the White House for a poetry reading. He is a "thug" you see, although anybody who knows Common professionally or personally, or for that fact listens to his music, knows that is hilarious bullshit. During this coverage, Fox News displayed their lack of object permanence, criticizing this "thug" rapper who they had recently praised for being, well, a not-thug. The low-point of the conversative media's coverage of this event was this gem right here, where the writer deliberately misspells Common's lyrics, because hey that's how thugs (read: black people) talk, right?
  • Zack Ryder blew the fuck up like he was supposed to.
  • Andrew Breitbart continued to be an irredeemable shithead, lacking any semblance of integrity.
  • A rap collective called OFWGYMCA captured the imaginations of hipsters everywhere. Their main producer, Tyler, the Creator, released an album recently, and I will be reviewing it later in the week. Another member of the group, Frank Ocean, also will be getting a physical release for his debut work, Nostalgia,Ultra., which thus far is, along with James Blake, and The Greatest Story Never Told, one of my top three albums of 2011.
  • Reddit continued to have server trouble. It's continuous uptime record now stands at 8 days. Yay!
  • The x key came off my laptop's keyboard. The key itself still works, but I now have to press down on the sensor, which I occasionally miss, given that I've been used to having a tactile button there for 2 years now.
  • Portal 2 was released. There has been no news on Half Life: Episode 3.
  • The Republican Party failed to produce one viable presidential candidate. They still have time though, I'm sure Chris Christie will fly in and save the day.
  • I started playing basketball again, and finally developed a jumper that occasionally gets points. I've also finished one of the items on my summer list: Beat my brother in a game of 1-on-1 (I won 8-6).
  • I started a tumblr. Mostly because two of my favourite bloggers, Mobute Sese Seko, and Bethlehem Shoals, started blogging there, and the tumblr dashboard is actually quite usable. I now follow a couple of poni blogs, and also a handful of artist blogs (in that they are run by artists, but are not exclusively for art) that are, for the most part, in some way related to Homestuck, either directly or tangentially.
  • One of the artists linked above, Emmy Cicierega, has a book called The Balloon Adventure, which is one of the best things I have read since going to college. It's a wordless comic, and it's a transcendant comic. Her brother, Neil, did Brodyquest, which is also amazing, for different reasons.
  • One of the writers linked above, Bethlehem Shoals, was one of the minds behind FreeDarko, a sublime basketball blog which closed shop early April. It's store is still open, and there you can find fantastic prints, and you can also purchase the FreeDarko Undisputed Guide to Basketball History on amazon. I haven't read it yet, but that shit is on it's way to my location, and I am very excited to receive it. Shoals is currently blogging the NBA Playoffs over at GQ, with the help of luminaries such as David Roth, and Carles (of "Hipster Runoff").
  • David Foster Wallace's final book, the unfinished novel The Pale King, was released. I picked up a copy in the Dundalk library, and am currently in the process of reading it. Since I own near on the entire Wallace bibliography in paperback, I didn't want to muss it up by buying his final work in hardcover. It just wouldn't fit. But the book is great, albeit not as great as Consider the Lobster, one of the greatest essay collections ever published.
  • Jack Warner fell on the sword so that Sepp Blatter could secure another term as FIFA President. Blatter ran on a platform of reform. It isn't even funny anymore.
  • The Butler Bulldogs made yet another underdog run to the NCAA Championship, and then had one of the worst performances by any team in the Men's D-1 Basketball Championship game, ever.
  • David Norris made some comments regarding paedophilia a decade ago, and they've been brought up again. I don't need to tell you what connections people are going to make.
  • Barack Obama and the Queen visited. Pissy republicans (you're not alone, America, our Republicans are 95% idiots too!) tried to protest the latter, by flipping people off and saying she was wanted for war crimes. It was hilarious. Sinn Fein decided Aengus ó Snodaigh would best represent them on television. He made an ass of himself. During the Obama visit, I went to a pub and met some Mitch Daniels voters.
  • I planned out dozens of blog posts for the next three months, so if you're one of the dozen or so people who visited in the last two months, you have much to look forward to.
That's a decent, mostly apolitical recap of the last two months (getting into the politics would take another 10,000 words and several broken keyboards). I've updated my blogroll on the side, including the best baseball blog (Pitchers & Poets), and the best general/political blog (Et tu, Mr. Destructo?). Check those out. They're a lot better than this blog.

Every time I hit the ground,
Cathal

entry.title: The Season Finale
entry.content:
I have stuck with the Seasons plan, as it turns out. 4-5 months on, 2 months off. So I should be back at the tail end of May, although I might post a Detox review in April if it actually comes out. I actually posted a lot this month, my most prolific of the "season", with 16 posts including this one. Actually I have a bunch of stuff planned for My Ace Hen Season 3, including:
  • A bunch of reviews of rap albums nobody really cares about
  • A Def Jux retrospective
  • Blog posts about cookies
  • Reviews of other stuff, like The Pale King and Legend of Korra
  • More posts about the dull minutiae of my life
  • Cookies

I wasn't entirely sure how exactly how to finish this up, so I'm just going to list off some observations and memories and such that I have collected over the past week. A kind of montage sequence, fitting for the ending of a season as glorious as the second season of My Ace Hen, which was way better than the first, which let's not talk about that. I might at some point update the archive to reflect the season categories, once I find out how to do that.

Also, before we get to the collected observations, I made "covers" as such for the My Ace Hen seasons, using pictures of Marceline playing a guitar and the Pittsburgh Pirates smoking, respectively. This new post editor has made posting and placing these images a lot easier. Thanks Google/Blogger! The first, obviously, represents the short posts of the first season, which were often simply about myself, and were often quite melancholic. The picture I chose makes me very sad. Marceline is one of my favourite Adventure Time characters. The second picture is some baseball players sitting around and smoking and (presumably) talking some old bullshit. Which is pretty much what the second season was.

  • My most peaceful memory is climbing a mountain at 6a.m., with Christine's two dogs, and fondly regarding the magnificent vista before me. I didn't sleep that night, and on the way down I listened to Blood on the Tracks. I ate Coco Pops out of a brandy snifter. I watched Fresh Prince and witnessed two straight men spooning in a manner that was vaguely post-coital. Or post-broital, in that case. I myself have never spooned anyone.
  • I should probably be taking more risks. How badly can you embarrass yourself with someone you've only met once?
  • This year, there have been opportunities I have let pass by. But, for the most part, I have taken up every offer which it was possible for me to take. This has been a good thing, I will continue doing this. One exception was the Drawing with Don night, which I totally should have gone to.
  • Although I am quite fond of my beard, I think generally I don't find them attractive on other people. I can't think of why this is.
  • More organizations should follow the NCAA's lead, and allow for free international streaming of sporting events. Nothing is lost by the NBA if they, say, allow me to stream games on their website from Ireland. In fact one might argue they would gain from such practices.
  • The Dreamcast failed because it was ahead of it's time. It should have also had a DVD drive, rather than using that proprietary format, which ironically, although it's creation was partially motivated by piracy concerns, ended up being the format for the console that is pretty much the easiest ever to pirate games for. On any Dreamcast model produced before a certain date (late in the console's life span, if I recall correctly) you can play any burned disc straight up with no fancy mathematics.
  • Today I found a red lightsaber on the beach. Later, I saw a child walking around with a blue one. I was reminded of my brother and I as young children. On the rare occasion (about twice a year tops) we went to McDonalds, we would always be given the same Happy Meal toy. My brother guessed this was a ploy on the part of staff to prevent sibling jealousies and rivalries. This seems uncharacteristically compassionate and complex for McDonalds staff. Not that they are stupid, but I always assumed they didn't care that much. I'm guessing the people who did this though (it was the McDonalds in Drogheda) turned out to be great parents.
  • As a child, I thought Star Wars and Star Trek to be the same thing. I watched and enjoyed Star Trek before Star Wars. The Star Trek reboot was a massive improvement on a decent work, but the Star Wars reboot was a desecration of a classic.
  • Ask me about my Gilmore Girls impression.
  • Howth is a beautiful place, out of a picture book. Today, someone said they pity people who have never seen the sea. I endorse this sentiment.
  • I have never understood the appeal of Aerosmith.
  • I sometimes jokingly place blame for my issues as such on my Catholicism. Really, I think it has little do with it.
  • The main purpose of welfare should be to help people get back to paying taxes.
  • A government should, at the very least, enforce contracts and ensure people's rights are not denied.
  • Very little can be done about climate change at this point, except maybe hope for a big volcanic eruption somewhere.
  • Once, when asked what their most controversial opinion was, someone said he found it incredibly selfish when humans campaigned against climate change of their own making. I found I couldn't really argue with him.
  • It is a mistake to think of evolution as directed.
  • I am still sometimes very awkward around new friends.
  • I downloaded a Frisky Dingo torrent today. It came with a file called "The Libertarian Socialist Revolution.txt". I'll say what I said about the Obama Little Big Planet levels. Surely there's a better way of getting your message out.
  • To ensure your drug use does not fund organised crime, buy only homegrown marijuana from people you know personally. Their seeds have mostly likely come from legitimate organisations which concern themselves with the trafficking of said seeds, rather than sex workers or general near-slave labour.
  • There are people with whom I was once very close, who would probably not acknowledge me were I to pass them on the street today. There was no falling out in these cases, and I find it surreal that we were once so familiar.
  • On the other hand, there are people with whom my familiarity has risen and fallen over the years. Actually, I can only think of one person this applies to. We once went nearly a year without talking, but I would like to think that before and after that year, we were and are good friends.
  • If I could own three albums on vinyl, they would be Loveless, Funcrusher Plus, and Blood on the Tracks.
  • Sometimes, if I catch myself thinking something less than wholesome, I will then think something really unspeakably horrible, and check around to make sure nobody is reading my thoughts.
  • I am very psyched for Wrestlemania this year, even though I am not a huge fan of Pro Wrestling.
  • I think of different first person shooters as slightly varied rule sets for the same sport, in a manner analogous to house rules for Monopoly.
  • Although I think Odd Future are alright, I simply don't get the big deal everyone is making about them. To me it just seems to be dickriding of the most whorish degree. Their Funny or Die video was painfully clichéd unfunny. I have high hopes for their Adult Swim pilot though.
  • I don't understand the smoking of cigarettes.
  • The nicest whiskey I've ever had was 70% a.b.v. proof cooking whiskey, whose label simply read WHISKEY in large type, and, proof aside, had basically no information.
  • When I was young, I was so into flags I got into trouble for it.
  • I am also really psyched for the Final Four. I love the underdogs in sports.
  • On the other hand, I really hate Cristiano Ronaldo, who I will never refer to as "Ronaldo" because he will never be the best player by that name.
  • Trying to stand out in a large college class is like trying to stand out in a Brazilian football tryout.
  • I have hidden over half of my Facebook friends list from my news feed, and since I have done so, I have been a lot happier generally.
  • You could get a bike for a million pokedollars, but you would never get this much money no matter how long you played for.
  • A Facebook 'dislike' button is a terrible idea, and it shouldn't be hard to figure out why.
  • My 4chan usage has decreased as my "Average hours socializing a week" has increased.
  • I once ran an mp3 blog called Running Dog for a week. I used to troll forums with that name on Highway67.
  • There are 3 people who owe me money. They gots to pay soon.
  • Baking is great for relieving stress.
  • I hate who I was 2 years ago. Who I was 2 years ago hated who I was 4 years ago. And so on.
  • After using good earphones, cheap iBuds just seem terrible and unusable.
  • Skullcandy is bad and you should feel bad.
  • I really enjoyed Monster Rancher growing up.
  • I feel awesome when someone comments on my blog.
  • Although I haven't played it, I think Magicka's spellcasting system is genius.
  • Peter King. Cristiano Ronaldo. Tim Buckley. They are all names on my List of Terrible People.
  • I simply don't understand the behaviour of Ghaddafi's (sp?) forces currently. Surely they realise they've set themselves on a slope towards Not Being in Power?
  • I would be very surprised if the woman they raped and called a traitor at the journalist's hotel is still alive.
  • Khadafi is too terrible even for the List of Terrible People.
  • I am not sure if I am capable of the constant emotional and physical effort needed (extrapolating from experiences in shorter relationships) for a long-term relationship.
  • I think people who cheat are not cool. If you are in a position where you cheat why not just end the relationship before the fact?
  • I have made a papercraft Weighted Companion Cube. For science.
  • I eagerly await shorts weather.
  • When I started this blog I did not have a beard. Could you even call that living?
Well there goes Season 2. If you're one of the maybe 4 or 5 people who stuck with it the whole way, thanks for reading! Also, here is a teaser of sorts for the third season.

entry.title: 2 years of blogging
entry.content:
Back when I started this blog, it was called Everything is Green. Then it was called The Sand, The Sea. Now it's called My Ace Hen, which is the best title of the three. But it's been 2 years since I started this blog solely to host a short story I had written. I reckon this blog has gotten a lot better since it started, and I'm both a better writer and a better, more interesting person. Here is a picture of a cupcake with a 2 candle on it.


Anyway, here's to at least 2 more years of this. I'm definitely not too old for this blogging shit.

2 MORE YEARS,
Cathal

entry.title: Nate Dogg 1969-2011
entry.content:
I will miss you, Nate Dogg. So many tracks were elevated by mere presence of your cadence. Hip-hop is a less musical place with you gone.

I don't smoke weed everyday, but today I will,
Cathal

entry.title: Lasers
entry.content:
I've never really been huge on Lupe Fiasco. Sure I thought Superstar and that song from his first album that sampled Travis were pretty dope, but it kind of stopped there. I still have his first 2 albums and that manifesto/mixtape thing on my iPod (actually another track of his I like is his rap over The National Anthem). I mean this album has been out a while and I haven't even bothered downloading it until now. But thanks to the lovely fellows at RapGodfathers, I now have a copy, without the iTunes bonus tracks, so I'm going to review it and see if it is indeed as bad as everyone says.

1. Letting Go (feat. Sarah Green) (produced by King David)
Eh this has a nice start, but then about 25 seconds in it goes downhill. Sarah Green actually had spots on his last 2 albums actually. The chorus is kind of catchy. The rapping is also mildly impressive, in that C-student backpacker kind of way. It seems to be entirely about the label trouble surrounding the release of Lasers. Meta! This chorus is actually really excellent. There's a weird intercom-effect on the vocal track too, reminiscent of Gorgeous off Kanye's last album, and to a lesser extent, Krazy Kings. Actually this commentary on a controversy on the object of controversy itself reminds me of Nas's Untitled. Also, apparently his Uzi weighs a ton. But this is a really excellent chorus. It sounds like it's transplanted from a latter-day Eminem song. Sarah Green's spot at the end on the other hand is pretty irritating. Overall this is a good start.

2. Words I Never Said (feat. Skylar Grey) (produced by Alex da Kid)
I mentioned Eminem in the last one, and speak of the devil this song has Skylar Grey, who wrote the chorus for Love the Way You Lie, and sings the chorus on that new Dr. Dre song that sucks and has Eminem. I really don't like her voice. Hey more nice sounding piano. The beat isn't terrible, again it sounds like something that could have been on Twisted Fantasy. Ah balls, it's a political track. Military-Industrial Complex! Budget cuts are bad! Cover-ups! Also a well-phrased couplet about the lack of actual news on the news. And suddenly, the idiot bomb is dropped. He didn't vote for Obama because Obama didn't speak out about something that happened after Obama was elected. I think? He's not voting for Obama in 2012 just so you know. Because he's peaceful. Yeah actually this is produced by Alex da Kid. This could easily fit in on Eminem's next album, maybe it would be better than Mosh, which represents the low point of political rapping. Also some really juvenile rhymes here. Actor/factor and such. The chorus grows on you. It belongs on a song about some failed relationship, not some juvenile faux-profound political shit. The chorus just soars.

3. Till I Get There (produced by Needlz)
Reminds me of Paris Tokyo from The Cool. Pretty obviously aimed for the charts. More nice sounding piano noises, catchy. Rapping is technically solid, unimpressive. There's not a whole lot to say here. It just kind of floats by without leaving an impression. This could fit in on a romantic comedy soundtrack pretty well. A montage scene where the lead has screwed up in someway, and the montage is about their re-adjusting to life without their soulmate.

4. I Don't Wanna Care Right Now (feat. MDMA) (produced by The Audibles)
Eh. This album is really all over the place philosophically. The rapping here is awful, he ends every few lines with a kind of fake-out thing, incredibly irritating. Attempt at a another chart hit, beat reminiscent of any number of Steve Aoki crew tracks. The verses seem to be hey-mom-watch-this exercises. They fall on their face. Also the guy on the chorus has a vague fake patois going on. Kind of infectious. Again, this chorus would be perfect for another, better song, with another, better rapper. The guest choruses here in general are earworms, which makes sense given that apparently like 8 of the tracks here are just focus-grouped shit that was meant for B.o.B. or something.

5. Out of My Head (feat. Trey Songz) (produced by Miykal Snoddy)
Trey Songz. He's really scraping the chart-barrel here. Beat sounds like a Homestuck reject. I've actually never heard of 4 of the 5 different producers so far. Again chorus belongs on a different song. He should have gotten R. Kelly on this. Made some Chicago anthem. "You're killing me, I think a need a will in here", sample rhyme. The beat again has an earworm quality. It just burrows in there. I could bug out to this if it didn't have Lupe.

6. The Show Goes On (produced by Kane Beatz)
Samples Float On. It works, in a cheesy pop-rap kind of way. Of course not a patch on the original. Again this beat should have been given to a better MC. Das Racist, for example, would murder this. Actually, fuck, this beat is fucking amazing.  The chorus is too. Fuck, it's just so catchy. Plus since it samples a popular rock song I can troll with it. But seriously, this beat man. This is the first track so far that I could say has replay value. Mixtape staple in years to come, one hopes. Someone else could make this a classic. Make this the 4th Lupe song I like. The lyrics are just some rise-up bullshit, lazy. Kind of a waste. Also, shouldn't a track called The Shows Goes On close out an album? Apparently the label forced this one on him. It actually broke the Top 40 over in the States. He has nothing to say about it. Also apparently he was told not to rap "too deep", as if Lupe Fiasco has ever been truly "deep". That might explain the tired concepts he kicks here. Somebody else get on this please.

7. Beautiful Lasers (2Ways) (feat. MDMA) (produced by King David)
Stadium sound. I'm assuming the songs Lupe salvaged from his vision of Lasers were the ones produced by this guy. The first time so far I could call the rapping good. I wouldn't be averse to hearing the original version of this album. I'm just wanting to listen to The Show Goes On again while I listen to this. The themes and imagery here are not really any better than the "not too deep" raps on The Show Goes On. Again a nice chorus. MDMA doesn't really have the kind of patois twinge here either. Eh.

8. Coming Up (feat. MDMA) (produced by King David)
Another Lupe/MDMA/King David team up. Beat is again catchy. Raps are again not. I think he's rapping about the ladies. The chorus feels like a fugitive from 80s hair metal. That's not a good thing. Overall the track reminds me of Thank You off The Blueprint 3, with more coherent rhymes. These beats are actually solid. Just damn solid. They're just crying out for a different MC. Oh wow MDMA is just terrible here. He was good on the other two tracks, but he's just awful here. He kind of redeems himself at the end.

9. State Run Radio (feat. Matt Mahaffey) (produced by King David)
Eh I'm really not feeling the beat here. Not at all. Nor am I feeling the singer here. I think he's kicking more political raps. Also, I'm pretty sure that the U.S. military is asking for less cash overall, but facts and a 3-dimensional perception of time, as we discovered earlier, won't silence Lupe the Firebrand! Eh on the whole the raps here are slightly better than on Words I Never Said. But I mean it's still bad. This track can't end fast enough.

10. Break the Chain (feat. Eric Turner and Sway) (produced by Ishi)
Seems to be another meta-track about the making of the album. The beat has a stop-start thing going on, and Lupe does decent work with it. Beat again sounds like a Steve Aoki cast off. Chorus is woeful. Sway absolutely burns Lupe on this. He is just so much better. Not that it's hard, but he just effortlessly blows Lupe out of the water on it. Come to think of it, that's the first guest verse thus far. Odd. And then Lupe's back, and the track is back to sucking. This is proof positive that these beats deserve better rappers. I'm not even a fan of Sway and I think his verse is way better than Lupe's.

11. All Black Everything (produced by The Buchanans)
The Buchanans had a beat on The Black Album way back when, but I don't recall hearing anything by them since. The beat once again feels like a cast-off from the last Kanye album. In particular, a sped up version of Devil in a New Dress. More political raps I think, this time some afronationalism or something? An alternate history where, as the title suggests, it's All Black Everything, and W.E.B. DuBois writes the constitution. Does he mean like an alternate constitution written in the late 19th century or? Actually I had to look up the lyrics, yes it seems he is suggesting that it is feasible, in this All Black Everything world, for a man born in 1868 to have written the U.S. constitution. Jesus Christ. Well Lupe doesn't listen to the lies they teach people in schools (he mentioned this earlier) so I guess this is consistent with that. These lyrics are woeful. I mean you could maybe write an interesting alternate history novel about this concept, but Lupe butchers it with like woeful WHAT IF bullshit that is certifiably ape-shit ballistic and would be laughed off even the dodgiest althist boards. He also asserts that slavery seemed to have come to Africa borne on slave ships, which, yeah but no.  This entire thing is dodgy. Ahmadinejad wins a peace prize (he's not some piece of shit in this timeline I take it) and Bush is in Iran? Huh? This is hilarious. It reminds me of a scene in The Boondocks, where Thugnificent goes on Bill Maher to reposition himself as a community leader, and makes an ass of himself thanks to complete ignorance of everything. A laugh-riot.

12. Never Forget You (feat. John Legend) (produced by Jerry duPlessis, Syience, and Arden Altino)
Man is John Legend wasted here. For once, Lupe outshines the guest star. The beat has a nice feeling about it, like it belongs in a sports biopic. The chorus here is just weak. The beat on the other hand is decent. It has the aforementioned feeling. Actually several of the tracks on Lasers feel tailor-made for mid-level studio films. This could actually, given the lyrical content, fit on a romantic comedy also. The big triumphant declaration-of-love scene. I'm guessing this soundtrack quality many of the tracks have is entirely intentional, a way of getting some extra off-the-books income for the label, since they've pretty much dictated the content here, the way Lupe tells it.

Well that's about it. Overall I mean the album isn't the car crash I was led to believe, but it's still bad. Just bad in a completely nondescript way. Like I can't even remember why it was bad now that it's over, but rather I just remember it being bad. Except The Show Goes On. I'm putting that shit on repeat. Anyway, it would seem that all that selling-out Lupe did for this album paid off, because it sold over 200,000 copies it's first week out, which for a rap album in 2011, is just really fucking impressive. I mean Big Boi made an actual good album and he didn't even break 6 figures opening week. Apparently Lupe has another album (which comes with the subtitle "The Great American Rap Album", which lollerskates) in the works, which, in keeping with the label-mandated trend hopping he is on, is a "sequel", in so far as a non-concept rap album can really have one. I mean this certainly isn't going to make my list of good albums come year end, but it's not going to be on the "How Can You Fucking Suck So Much?" list either. Although it might sound like the beats are good, they're more just catchy, y'know the way mediocre house music is.

I'd give it a C-, or 2.5 stars, or 5/10, if I had to grade it,
Cathal

entry.title: Collected errata, or, It's 2 a.m. which is the perfect time to unload some of the bad stuff
entry.content:
Today's chemistry lab was basically a practice computer simulation, and my first molecular modelling lab. Honestly, it went fantastically. Normally in my first experiment of a set, I struggle a bit, but this one was all Hells Yeah. I had the actual body of the experiment done in about half an hour, and I felt like a CachE god. And I was able to infer the general rule about pi electrons and chemical reactions too. I AM JUST SO FLY FOR A CHEMISTRY GUY.

Also, I gave that 4chan Chakra Roll thing a go, using a random number generator instead of a series of 4chan posts. So I mean I may as well post it here then. Here goes.

Muladhara: 7) Tell about when you were most afraid in your life
Oh man I remember this one. When I was like 11 or 12, me and my brother did some entry-level sailing thing at the Carlingford club relating to the area of sailing. It was a pretty nasty week, horrible weather, terrible seas. But at one point my boat capsized and my lifejacket all fell off and it was like damn. I probably would have been fine but like it was pretty nasty, I was absolutely fucking terrified.

Svadhistana: 2) List 5 ways you can be happier
I didn't really get this one. There's probably some David Foster Wallace quote that's pertinent, but I can't for the life of me find it. But I can't even try doing this one, I mean 5 ways, it's like why not 100?

Manipura: 8) How can understanding your emotions be benificial?
Well I mean this one is pretty obvious. A deeper understanding of one's own emotions can help both during deliberations over future actions, and in analysis of past mistakes.

Anahata: 5) Tell about a time you were rejected
The first time I did my leaving cert, I got an interview for admission to Cambridge, which I proceeded to fuck up spectacularly, not that my chances were great to begin with. I didn't get the place anyway, which was kind of a bummer, but in the end I got a course that I very much enjoy, so I mean it worked out all right.

Vishuddha: 8) How can you turn failure into a learning experience
I'm pretty sure I'm goofing on the answers to these types of open-ended questions. Perhaps when I spend more time formulating my thoughts with regards to them I will edit the post to include the superior answers. I probably shouldn't try blogging at 2 in the morning. Hey, I've just turned failure into a learning experience.

Ajna: 2) Tell about a time you benefitted from following instinct
I'm not entirely sure I can delineate instinct from the other influences on my thought processes, so I have kind of have to cop out here. I mean I think pretty fast I'm not sure how many decisions I made based on following instinct alone.

Sahasrara: 7) Meditate for at least five minutes
Done

That was actually pretty fun, and I might do another one again at some point. Chakra roll I mean. As much as I enjoyed my first MM lab, I'm not lining up to do more, although it actually would be enjoyable. Also, HOMO is a chemistry term. It stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital. I now just have to find an image that communicates that concept, and write in NO in comic sans MS, and I've finished my fourth comic.

Roffles,
Cathal

entry.title: Inspirational Ish with Gilbert Arenas
entry.content:
This is fucking excellent. Adidas does top notch ads for the NBA, for example they did with FreeDarko a while back. Anyway, Arenas, let's ignore the gun thing, is a great, exciting player. His apology for the gun thing in the Washington Post was also nice. I think if we're going to collectively forgive Michael Vick (although I'm gonna go ahead and postulate part of the forgiveness comes from everybody's joy at seeing him play at the level he hinted at pre-lockup), then we should extend Arenas that same courtesy. He's also the source for the quote in my About Me section. Damn, son. Also this video got me listening to Athlete again. Tourist was one of the first albums I bought for myself. I stopped buying albums later. The story behind his original jersey number is also pretty cool. As I remember it, he chose 0 because that's the number of minutes he was told he'd get in college. He went on to become an NBA All-Star.

Impossible is 0,
Cathal

entry.title: Snippets from a text adventure of no consequence
entry.content:
A couple of months ago I set out, on suggestion of a friend, to make a text adventure based on some ideas he had. It's been postponed because our time be gettin' sucked up by other obligations, but I've posted what's been done of it here. Commands input by the player are in bold and passages that are not part of the plot are in italics, everything else is in plaintext. Enjoy. The misogyny within is not representative of me, but rather the player.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You are DANTE BARRETT, 18. You have INTERESTS. Foremost among them has to be PRO WRESTLING. You are particularly fond of the superstar, CM Punk, who you strive to emulate.
You disdain INDEPENDENT WRESTLING, you find it barbaric and staid, and you have not watched THE WRESTLER for this reason.
You are standing in THE STUDY
You are surrounded by your POSSESSIONS including your LAPTOP, IPOD, and GUITAR, which you occasionally practice at, in your quest to become a FAMOUS SELL-OUT ROCKSTAR, with your best friend Patrick.
You have many things to do, and IMPENDING EXAMS loom large on your horizon. Although you care little for religion, you subscribe to the BRO philosophy of one Stinson, which has helped you solve many ethical conundrums.
Your PHONE is ringing, and a SKETCHPAD, where you hone your ARTISTIC TALENTS, is open on the desk. You are facing NORTH, and there is an exit to the WEST, and a door to the SOUTH. What do you do?
Sketchpad
You go to the sketchpad, and look at it, unsure of what else you should do.
You need to specify an action
Draw
[You sit at the DESK CHAIR, and grab a PENCIL beside the SKETCHPAD. You decide to draw, closing your eyes and simply letting your hand express itself, as it were. A drawing of a blond, creative woman takes form.
It is clear that the drawing is that of one of your TEACHERS, who has since left the SCHOOL where you pursue studies in art, amongst other disciplines.
You have fond memories of this teacher, although you cannot remember her name, which means it is either something terribly common, or terribly rare. You curse your sieve-like mind, since this prevents you from creeping on FACEBOOK.
The drawing is complete, what do you do?
You do nothing for what seems like hours, and you are awoken from your mysterious daydreams by a knock at the window.
Oh no, it is CRAZY EYES, the woman beast of your worst psychosexual nightmares.
She punches through the window, getting BLOOD everywhere.
It is too late to escape; you bite a cyanide pill, since suicide is preferable to copulating with that thing.]

THESE ARE THE CONSEQUENCES OF INACTION. RETRY?

YES
The drawing is complete, what do you do?
Go to the door
You approach the DOOR, which is of the finest craftsmanship, fashioned from WELL-AGED OAK. You are not sure why you know this, and it certainly will never be of any consequence, ever.
At the door is your good friend, CAFFERTY, who has a voice that sounds like cigarettes, but cigarettes when they signified class and mystery. She seems excited about something. What do you do?
Ask why she's excited
You inquire as to the reason for your FRIEND's excitement. It turns out a renowned COMEDIAN, of who you share a mutual fandom, is playing a one-off show in this very country. She insists it is of the utmost importance that you acquire TICKETS.
What do you do?
I get tickets
You try to get tickets, but you have no idea how do to that.
What do you do?
Go on the internet
You open up your laptop, and try to open Google, but it seems the WIRELESS NETWORK is not available. It is located in another room. What do you do?
Connect by cable for handiness
You grab an ETHERNET CABLE, and insert it into the PORT on the side of your laptop. The sexual undertones of this action do not escape you. Luckily Christine is entranced by a mysterious light emanating from the BOOKSHELF.
You browse to ALTAVISTA, your favourite search engine, to look for tickets, but you have forgotten the comedian's name. What is his name?
Dylan Moran
Ah, DYLAN MORAN, how could you have forgotten? Rumours of a ONE-OFF FAREWELL SHOW SOMEWHERE IN THE SOUTH OF ULSTER have been brewing for some time.
However, searching his name yields little information, but just mounds of mildly repulsive erotic fan fiction. What do you do?
Read the erotic fan fiction
With some misgivings, you browse to MORANLOVE.TK, to read these stories which have buried the search results you really wished to see. What you see is not pleasant. Moran violently sodomises DARA O BRIAIN, and the act causes him to inflate to a GIANT SIZE. This gives you an idea.
What do you do?
Turn off the laptop
Disgusted, you push the laptop away from you and close it, sending it into sleep mode. But not before you forward the story to BENNA, a crazy girl who appears to have an unreal obsession with you handcuffing her. Perhaps this will scare her off.
What do you do?
Leave the room
You leave the room, leaving Christine behind. You have abandoned your bro, so uncool. You are unsure of where you want to go next. You are in a HALLWAY, downstairs are the LIVING AREA, DINING ROOM, and KITCHEN, and in this section of the house are the PALACE OF WISDOM, your BEDROOM, and the BEDROOMS of other family members.
What do you do?
Go back and get Christine
Then go to the palace
You return to retrieve CHRISTINE, and together you head to the PALACE OF WISDOM. However, it is trashed. It seems you have not cleaned it since your cousins were here last week. As Gilda the Griffon would say, what a bunch of lame-os.
You see your GAMES SYSTEM, and ASSORTED GAMES, including GOD OF WAR, which you have not yet completed. Also visible are your TELEVISION, and BOMB-ASS SOUND SYSTEM, on which you jam your all-time favourite band, TAKING BACK SUNDAY.

Suddenly, you are informed via Text Message that CHRISTINE has joined your PARTY. You aren't really sure what this means in the long-run.
What do you do?
Leave the house with my party
You want to leave the house, and the nearest exit is the WINDOW to the PALACE of WISDOM. You bust it out open, and fashion some bed sheets into a kind of rope to aid your descent.
You have reached your DRIVEWAY; visible are OTHER HOUSES, and a ROAD. You are facing NORTH.
The road goes WEST-EAST.
What do you do?
Go to Sha's house
You head out to SHA'S HOUSE, although it has not yet been explained who SHA is, or even where her house is. However, the fearless narrator shall fill in some blanks.
You and SHA, which is an affectionate contraction of SHAUNA, her full given name, go back a long time. You both attended the same PRIMARY SCHOOL, where you learned the basic Rs, including WRITING, and RITHMETIC. You don't really care much for reading, unless said book is either the sacred text, THE BRO CODE, or CM PUNK'S GUIDE TO LIVIN STRAIGHT, NO HOMO.
SHA is excitable, and friendly. She is very sociable, and has cousins that scare you in ways you can't quite define.
When you reach the house, it seems neither she, nor her cool bro, KYLE, are available.
You have a bad feeling about this.
What do you do?
Walk to the bus stop
You walk to the BUS STOP, where you can find PUBLIC TRANSPORT, ready and willing to transport you to the nearby TOWN, where you do much of your shopping, socializing, and alcohol consumption.
The bus arrives, and you get on board.
SHA has joined your party.
You walk to the BUS STOP, where you can find PUBLIC TRANSPORT, ready and willing to transport you to the nearby TOWN, where you do much of your shopping, socializing, and alcohol consumption.
You reach TOWN. You are at the BUS DEPOT, to your left is a SHOPPING CENTRE, in front of you is a smaller SHOPPING CENTRE, and to your right is the TOWN CENTRE, which is the hub of town life.

Check missed calls!
Ah, of course, you completely ignored your phone call from earlier. You grab your totally sweet PHONE and go to the call register, to check MISSED CALLS. It turns out it was from your sister, but why would she be calling you at lunchtime on a Saturday? You ask SHA, but she has no clue. What do you do?
Ring her back
You type in 7; since this is your SISTER's binding on your SPEED DIAL THING, and awaits an answer. When she picks up, she is as excitable as anyone you have met today. She has some exciting news. It seems popular comedian, DYLAN MORAN, is playing a show soon. She suggests that getting tickets is the thing of the moment, but she, for once, is unsure of how to do that. She leaves it entirely in your hands. You are standing outside the BUS DEPOT, you haven't moved at all during this time. What do you do?
Go to buy tickets
You set out to buy DYLAN MORAN TICKETS, but it seems that the local TICKET REPOSITORY has shut down, since they hinged all their money on a LIMP BIZKIT concert only lame dudes went to. You'll have to find another way. What do you do?
Ask around for tickets
You harangue RANDOM STRANGERS for DYLAN MORAN TICKETS, but it seems that these lame dudes are totes out of the loop, and are not aware of the show. In fact, it seems that when you tell them, they instead ask you for tickets. The last person at the bus depot you have not approached, SHADY TRICKSTER STRANGER WHO IS PROBABLY HIGH, leaves before you can ambush him with questions. You are still standing at the BUS DEPOT, ticketless.
Go to the town centre
You head out for the TOWN CENTRE, a bustling hubbub of economic and social activity. There are two main areas here, the TOWN SQUARE, where one may often see HOBOS, and the MARSHES, where one may often see LISTLESS YOUTH. Where do you go?
Ask hobos for tickets
The HOBOS seem confused when you ask for TICKETS, but when they learn how valuable they are, they offer to assist you in your quest. FOUR HOBOS have joined your party; CHRISTINE asks them about their TROUBLED CHILDHOODS. You just want TICKETS. What do you do?
Have the hobos break into the place that sold the tickets
Feeling quite like a CRIMINAL MASTERMIND, you send the HOBOs forth to break into the TICKET REPOSITORY, in the hope that perhaps they had some DYLAN MORAN TICKETS. However, even if they do not, you can still get some TOUTABLE LOOT. The HOBOS break in like dudes jonesing for dark, absurdist humour, they return to you with a DULL BOX, which is shut with sellotape. One of them pulls a knife out of their coat pocket. What do you do?

What's a dull box?
You ask the HOBOs what a DULL BOX is, and they simply press the BOX, which is dulled from age, in front of you. The box is clearly labelled January 31st, 2010, a date that seems familiar for some reason. You brush off these petty concerns and try to open the box with your dull FINGERNAILS. Surely there is a better box-opening implement available in the immediate vicinity.
Take the knife and open the box with it
You grab the KNIFE, and HOBO MENTAL JIM is shocked by your speed. You cut open the box, and voila, there is a light emanating from it, like this was some shitty Thomas Kinkade painting or something. BOX OF LIGHT. But whatever, is this what you're looking for? Yes it is.
COMMERCIAL BREAK
Commercial break?!
The NARRATOR has returned from UNSPECIFIED BUSINESS. But as he had been saying, you have found what you are looking for. What is your next move?
Check how many tickets I have attained
You rummage through the box of TOUTABLE LOOT. Oh this is quite a haul. You have 6 DYLAN MORAN TICKETS, and also one ticket to AN EVENING WITH ADAM LAZZARA: MC'D BY EDGE. You don't really care what the other stuff is, but you're sure it will get you enough money for something nice.
You stand around doing nothing, and your PARTY of SEVEN INCLUDING YOU just stand around, loitering, being a menace to society. You hear a creepy breathing sound in the distance; it seems to be coming from the nearby STREET LIGHT.
RUN FROM THE STREET LIGHT
You run frantically from the STREET LIGHT, discomforted by its aura. Although perplexed, your PARTY has no choice to follow you, except for the HOBOs, you'd much rather sleep.
Where are you running to? asks your PARTY
To the marshes
To meet teenagers
You rush to THE MARSHES, the centre of TOWN LIFE, for TEENAGERS anyway. You like to hang out here and waste away the days, lacking any sort of higher calling. Plus the SUBWAY does some mean sandwiches that you just cannot resist. It seems that an old or relatively new friend is there anyway. She is busy being upset about her AMPLE BOSOM. What do you do?
Compliment the dids
You approach the BUXOM YOUNG FEMALE, and mention that you are wont to compliment her DIDS, given how ample they are. She seems charmed by your compliment, but also ashamed. She also seems mad at you, but it's not like you've done anything recently.
I ask what I've done
THE FUCK DID I DO, you exclaim, but quietly, because you're afraid what might happen if you publicly show contempt for this close friend whose name you have forgotten. Actually, what is her name?
Natalya
Because of the dids
THE FUCK DID I DO, NAT? you ask, knowing that calling her by her full, eastern-sounding name serves only to incite her fury. It seems she is not entirely sure why is she mad at you, which means there must be a really good reason so infuriating she has blocked it from her memory.
What do you do?
Compliment her dids again
"You have KILLER DIDS, they're like cushions man!" You aren't sure why you suddenly have such a keen interest in "dids all of a sudden". You have examined your behavioural patterns, and they definitely indicate violent, lustful homosexual monogamy with a HISTORY STUDENT. However, they are pretty good dids, so you roll with it. She blushes; it seems you are embarrassing her in front of her SECRET CRUSH. Natalya has TRUST ISSUES, and a STRONG NEED TO EXPRESS HERSELF CREATIVELY. You don't mind this since she's pretty good with words. She asks what you want to do, since she is kind of bored, and wants to escape from her SECRET CRUSH, before you cause any more embarrassment. You suddenly realise why she mad.

Leave the Marshes
You leave THE MARSHES, going NOWHERE IN PARTICULAR. You really just want to catch up with your breastacularly endowed friend, Nat. Your PARTY are familiar with her, although CHRISTINE is certainly much fonder of her than SHA. However the PARTY seems to have little independent thought capacity as of now, perhaps you need to unlock this feature by progressing through the current STORY MODE. Where do you go?
Go to the store
You go to THE SPIRIT STORE, a local pub run by ESTEEMED SENATOR MARK DEARY, and some other guy whose name you never cared to learn. It is like 12:25 by the time you get there, and since there is no match on today, banter is scarce. You approach the BAR COUNTER, CLARKSON is working the taps.
Why is it so damn early?
Fuck off to the park instead
It's 12? What the fuck bro, you're sure you're never up that early, not unless you're going to a FOREIGN ESTABLISHMENT OF LEARNING for an important, life-changing interview. Even then it's debatable whether you will actually get up on time. Thus your PROPENSITY FOR SLEEPING IN is established. You earn the BEDHEAD character trait. You head to THE PARK, a place where one can find a PLAYGROUND, filled with ENTERTAINMENT OF A LARGE AND PLASTIC NATURE, and a LARGE GREEN EXPANSE. There are also some TREES and a GAZEBO.
Hang in the gazebo
You approach the GAZEBO, which would in a civilized town play host to MUSICAL ENTERTAINMENT, but this being the place it is, it is simply a place for PESKY KIDS to loiter. You sit down; NAT does not join your party. It seems it is important that she play a role later that requires her never joining your TOTALLY COOL PARTY OF BROS. It is now time to name your PARTY. This name is unchangeable, so choose wisely.
The Peepulation
You have named your party THE PEEPULATION. This, of course, is a reference to the popular blog, FUCK THIS SHIT, I HAVE SURFING LESSONS. You think that's the title of it. You're not sure. All you know is that it is mad enjoyable. You sit around doing nothing at THE GAZEBO. Since none of you made a trip to THE OFFY, you can't even get your drink on.
Walk home
You WALK HOME. This is something you have endeavoured to do since you were a YOUNG LAD, FILLED WITH HOPES AND DREAMS. THE PEEPULATION is not so keen on the idea, and NAT doubts your ability to do it. You must roll for stamina. Actually, now would be a good time to apportion your STATS.
Give me a minute while I create the stat system, BROFIST
Looking forward to seeing this
Somehow you have survived HOBOs and THAT CREEPY LAMPOST thus far without apportioning your BROFIST points. You chose BROFIST points last year, when you did your EXAMS OF SCHOOLEND. You chose it over other systems, like FAGGOTS, and WEAKLIN. None of them compared to the elegant simplicity, the beauty, the practicality, the BRONESS, of BROFIST. You have 20 points to apportion, and values go from 0-9.
Broness
Robustness
Originality
Fortitude
Intelligence
Smoothness
Tact
You cannot apportion points to BRONESS, its value will rise and fall based on your actions in the game. It is a crude sort of morality system if you will. Actions are rated on a scale of RACKJACKER to STINSON, with 9 representing TRUE STINSON, and 0 representing TRUE RACKJACKER.
Hmm...
I can’t decide
Give me one of the presets
Hold on, I must explain the remaining stats.
ROBUSTNESS determines your RAW BRUTE STRENGTH. Your ability to CLIMB ROCKS, and PUNCH OUT WEAK DUDES, among other things, will be decided by this field.
ORIGINALITY determines your ability to be MAD FRESH. The quality of any ORIGINAL CONTENT you create is determined by this field.
FORTITUDE determines your HARDINESS and STAMINA, as well as your HEALTH and DEFENCE. You know how that goes.
INTELLIGENCE determines your ability to IMPROVISE, and THINK.
SMOOTHNESS determines your ability to get your SURFING PIKACHU ON with the FINE LADIES. It also determines your ability to talk your way into secured areas, and out of sticky situations.
TACT has been changed to TRIUMPH. This determines how LUCKY your WHITE ASS is.
There are no PRESETS, as nobody has yet played as DANTE BARRETT. Presets are determined by the actions of other players, and thus far there have been none.
DAMN
Ok
5 originality and intelligence
You can always LEVEL UP and gain BRO PTS to level up your STATZ. It might be necessary to GRIND A BIT, but the game is designed to avoid that.
4 for Smoothness
And the rest goes to the others
You apportion 5 to ORIGINALITY and INTELLIGENCE. Not only are your ideas MAD FRESH, but they are also WELL CONCEIVED. You are nobody's MICHAEL BAY, that's for certain.
You apportion 4 to SMOOTHNESS. Although it takes some work, you can get fresh with the FINE LADIES.
You apportion 2 to TRIUMPH, FORTITUDE, and STRENGTH. You are not in particularly good PHYSICAL SHAPE, although you can run for brief periods if need be. You are also not particularly LUCKY, but you are not so unlucky that CERTAIN VICTORIES can be transformed into DEFEATS.
By default, your two party members are assigned 3 to ALL FIELDS, and have 2 POINTS left over, to apportion at a later point, when certain skills might be necessary.
Sounds good
Also by default, you are given a BRO value of 4.5. You are not TOTALLY BRO right now, but you wouldn't go behind your bro's back. That shit just isn't cool. Although you might disregard DIBS for an INSANELY HOT CHICK I MEAN HOW IS SHE SO HOT OH GOD.
To walk HOME, you would need a FORTITUDE value of 4. It seems you just aren't up to it. What do you do?
HEY
I have never disregarded dibs
Look dude, in the interest of the game, you can't get your actual BRO VALUE of 9 straight away.
DAMN
Ok
What to do next
What are my options?
Plus DIBS have not yet been presented. You can regard them at the appropriate time.
?
Improvise; you can do anything, provided it is communicated to THE NARRATOR clearly.
Go to HMV
You head back to THE MARSHES, where the best vendor of entertaining products, HMV, is based. It is much better than GAMESTOP, which is a bit of an OVERPRICED SHITHOLE. Fuck, it is SO OVERPRICED.
You reach HMV, in front of you are sections dedicated to MUSIC OF VARIOUS GENRES, FILMS BOTH STANDARD, and HIGH-DEFINITION. There are also sections for THE VIDYA, and TELLY. There are also some tables with BOOKS on them, and some HARDWARE.
Browse for hours
You BROWSE FOR HOURS. You are not sure what your FUNDS are like. You see ITEMS OF INTEREST everywhere, as do other members of THE PEEPULATION. Have you made up your mind? ==COMMERCIAL BREAK==
I dislike commercial breaks
During the COMMERCIAL BREAK, you were presented with ADVERTISEMENTS for many DESIRABLE PRODUCTS on which you would like to drop some CA$H DOLLA$. You are sure owning these products will make you TOUGHER, IMPROVED, QUICKER, MORE ROBUST.
Have you decided to drop some CA$H DOLLA$ up in, or will you keep your MONEY for something else.
There are no CLOUDS in the SKY.
Keep the money
Go outside the marshes to chill and rate passing poon
You decide that it is not the time for NEW TIMES. You go outside and CHILL WITH THE PEEPULATION, and assign numerical values to FEMALES who walk by. The numerical values assigned are determined primarily by how desirable you find them.
THE PEEPULATION find this SLIGHTLY DISGUSTING, but nonetheless participate.
What is seen?
And what is done?
This isn't as fun without options...
It's like actually being at the marshes
But PLAYER, you must realise, although THE NARRATOR relates the world to you, he can only describe it. You must decide what to do. You have given LITTLE INFORMATION as to the current situation. Which set of benches are you placed upon, for example? IT IS A MYSTERY WRAPPED IN AN ENIGMA WRAPPED IN BAD GAME DESIGN.
Although there are times when you will be given a SET, LIMITED NUMBER OF OPTIONS TO PROCEED, now is not one of those times. THE NARRATOR cannot imagine anything EXCITING or PLOT-ADVANCING happening here.
Get me to the plot dammit
You try to advance quickly to the PLOT, throwing caution to the wind and disregarding important PLOT DEVELOPMENTS. You find, while being a misogynist, that your new ART TEACHER, MZ. THAUMA TURGE is walking by. You are reminded of your old art teacher, HERA PRAXITELES, who is not GREEK, despite her name. You remember her being a TOTAL BANG, and there certainly existed between you a sort of SPARK, the kind which, if applied to HOT, NAKED KINDLING, might result in the BURNING FLAME of SEXUAL RELATIONS, and PERHAPS BREAKFAST. However, it seems you did not get any contact information before she left for her new job... SOMEWHERE. Damn your previously mentioned poor memory. You are suddenly consumed with a SINGULAR DESIRE to GET FRESH with this FINE MADAMOISELLE PRAXITELES. Thanks to the internet, there are many ways of finding out where she currently is.
Do you wish to FIND HER ON THE INTERNET, or CONTINUE RATING A COLLECTION CONSISTING OF TOTAL BANGS AND TOTAL MUNTERS?
Compare total bangs and munters to the teacher
Then find her on the internet
It seems THE PEEPULATION is not familiar with MME. PRAXITELES. You feel it imperative to communicate to them just how impressive her physical beauty really is. You take a KIND OF SCARY TEENAGER, with DEMENTED EYES, as a 1, and a CHICK ON A MAGAZINE SOMEONE IS HOLDING, as a 10. You then say that neither compare to her. THE PEEPULATION is SUFFICIENTLY IMPRESSED. SWEET SHIT BRO.
You have a number of ways of accessing the INTERNET. Your PHONE informs you there a number of WIRELESS NETWORKS available. However, they are all PASSWORD PROTECTED, although you have heard rumours of an UNSECURED NETWORK down SUBWAYWAYWAYWAYOHFUCKTHAT. There are also a number of COMPUTER KIOSKS in THE MARSHES. What do you do?
Check out subway while getting food
You decide to go up to SUBWAY, to mack on some mad meatball marinaras, or whatever your LUNCHEON OF REPUTE is. You sure are glad you didn't spend money on that JOHN CENA DVD. Had you done so, you would lack SUFFICIENT FUNDS to have FREE REIGN OVER THE SUBWAY MENU. You arrive at the FOOD COURT. There are 4 EATERIES visible. THAT BAGEL PLACE, KFC, BURGER KING, and, of course, SUBWAY. Your phone confirms that SUBWAY FREE WIFI is available. You see TABLES, but as of now, nobody you recognise.
Get subway and sit down with my party
You go to SUBWAY, and sit down at a TABLE with THE PEEPULATION. You successfully connect to the NETWORK, but there is no INTERNET ACCESS. Balls. You figure you can RESOLVE THIS ISSUE, while also acquiring your MIDDAY LUNCHEON. Actually that’s redundant surely lunch can only happen in the middle of the day. The girl at SUBWAY is NICE, BUT NOT REALLY YOUR TYPE. She also looks NERDY, like she runs a GNU/LINUX INSTALLATION, in favour of WINDOWS. You can approach NICE GIRL, or talk to GEORGE HOOK DOPPELGANGER, who is the MANAGER OF THIS FINE ESTABLISHMENT, but probably was born before ALAN TURING AND CO broke THE ENIGMA CODE.
Talk to nice girl
You approach the NICE GIRL, and notice she is of ASIAN EXTRACTION, BUT THE HOTTER KIND, LIKE NORTHEAST ASIA, and MAYBE ONE OF THE ISLANDS. You think briefly about RIVERS CUOMO, who would almost definitely be getting his stalk on to this girl. Thankfully, you are nowhere near as creepy. What is your first course of action? Which is more important? Your hunger, or BANGING HOT ART TEACH, that is to say she is BANGING HOT, not that your immediate course of action is banging her. This NICE GIRL on the other hand.
Food is priority
"May I take your order?" she says, in a QUIET, UNASSUMING VOICE.
Here, above all else, syntax and word choice are key.
Nobody wants a disgusting BLAM AND BLURKYsandwich you can't eat.
I'll go for a chicken and bacon ranch please
You have failed to specify a BREAD CLASS for your MACKING DELICIOUS SUB. Reroll?
On Italian herb and cheese bread, foot long
She complies, and prepares a CHICKEN AND BACON RANCH SUB ON ITALIAN HERB AND CHEESE BREAD SANDWICH. You advance leftward, parallel to the counter, always facing her. At the REGISTER, she inquires is there anything else you would like?
Internet access perhaps?
"OH HEY GIRL, YOU KNOW BOUT YO WIRELESS WI-FI?" This is what a 5 SMOOTHNESS BRO talks like, you await eagerly the LEVELLING UP PROCESS, where you can improve yo LADEE SKILLZ. She replies in the positive, and pre-emptively guesses your problem. She goes back and resets the router. After a brief wait... SUCCESS, ALL IS WELL AGAIN. What now?
Eat sub while checking out teacher online
You go back over to THE PEEPULATION to enjoy your DELIRIOUS SUB, but it seems you forgot to PAY THE NICE LADY. This game really seems incapable of filling in blanks.
.....
Are you going to drop funds on this, or what?
Yes.
WAIT, it seems the NICE LADY is inexperienced, and completely CHARMED by anyone showing the slightest bit of interest whatsoever. The sub was free, and you get a SUBWAY CARD with 42 POINTS. It seems you did not get anything for THE PEEPULATION, you lose .1 BRONESS. You open up your phone. Where is your first stop on the cyber quest?
Facebook
You go to FACEBOOK, and search for HERA PIRAXELES, and get like way too many results. Damn, why the fuck was this name ever popular. You may refine your SEARCH RESULTS by inputting values into the LOCATION, OCCUPATION, and EDUCATION fields. There is also a NUMERICAL FIELD you may use, although it is unclear what the NUMERICAL VALUE could possibly refer to.
Wade through the results
You decide to FUCK REFINING THE SEARCH PARAMETERS, WE'RE GOING IN NAKED YO. You are quickly overwhelmed by FAT GREEK MUNTERS posing. You feel your sex drive diminish, just by looking at them.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So eh there it is. Apologies again for the misogyny, I'll try and tone it down when I edit it.

Cos I be all progressive and shit like,
Cathal

entry.title: Inherent plot appeal versus quality of execution: A blog collecting some brief notes and observations regarding Eddie Jordan's autobiography, An Independent Man
entry.content:
A couple of years ago, back when Dundalk's main street was a hotspot for purveyors (of a universally high quality) of second-hand goods, I purchased, from Oxfam, Eddie Jordan's autobiography, An Independent Man (published by Orion Books in 2007). As books go, it's not great. Jordan repeats himself and whenever a new character is introduced he falls back on one of three or four clichés. But still, despite this, I've read it something like three times, each time in no time at all, it is an easy as hell read. It should be mentioned before I blog this that this is basically, in extremely short form, a retelling of David Foster Wallace's essay, "How Tracey Austin Broke My Heart", which is in Consider the Lobster.

As I said, An Independent Man is not a great book, and I reckon the reason I've read it so frequently and with such ease and speed is due mainly to the inherent appeal a story about Jordan Grand Prix would have for me. Like I just ate up his account of the team's first seasons in F1 (and I actually learned some useless information about the qualifying set-up back then), his dealings with Michael Schumacher and Ayrton Senna, and, despite the fact that it was a short passage altogether, the parts dealing with the notorious 2000 season, which was the beginning of the end for the team, which today still exists in a way as Force India. Which leads me to another problem I had with the book, it's length. There is not nearly enough about the most interesting things, like the aforementioned 2000 season. Really I would have no problem with it being split into 3 distinct books, although I doubt this was a viable proposition. Also the book had some cool photos, of Eddie Irvine and such, which it seems many of the books I have read recently are of the sort that contain pertinent photos in the midsection, which probably reflects something or other.

That said, a well-written book charting Jordan Grand Prix's rise and fall could be a fantastic, engaging thing, but it's unlikely to happen; not that the general world of motor sport writing is lacking in talent, but that it would only really have niche appeal, unless maybe it had some world-rocking revelations about Michael Schumacher's life or something. Actually, I'd be really interested in reading a relatively technical biography of Gordon Murray, Adrian Newey, or Rory Byrne, three people who definitely had a far bigger impact on Formula 1 than Eddie Jordan (who certainly was quite influential himself, and, as the years went on and Jordan declined, started to take on a sort of Tyrellian role in the F1 world, sheltering Fisi and nurturing Timo Glock and Nick Heidfeld, along with a bunch of other guys who didn't amount to anything).

I might perhaps edit this post at a later point, after another reading of the text in question, to include more observations and commentary. In the meantime, it is worth one's while tracking down Wallace's aforementioned essay, which will communicate the point (which I have spectacularly failed to make) quite well.

All aside, the B&H ads Jordan had were really cool too,
Cathal

entry.title: Gunnin' for that Gold Medal
entry.content:
I actually managed to make in to my petrology lab today, despite my weakened physical state. In retrospect, it probably wasn't worth it. It was meant to be a revision lab, but fuck-all got done, but I did get my Paleo lab book back (got a 66, YEAH BITCHES). I also learned about streak plates, which will probably come in very handy in the practical exams themselves.

However, there was one wonderful piece of new fact gleamed from this lab. While the demonstrator talked to a group of us about a) the impossibility of getting above an 80 in CA, b) the dearth of dinosaurs in geology, c) how Ross Geller is a shitty geologist, and d) what we planned to specialise in, she told us one amazing thing: In Trinity, if you graduate with an average of 75 or higher (as a general rule. It's 75 in science, but some courses require an 80, medicine requires a 70, and TSMs require you have no grades below 70), you get a freaking gold medal! This is my life goal now. Getting that gold medal. I will get that 75 average, then I will get that gold medal, then I will get ALL THE PLAY, ALL OF IT! Oh and also all the prestige, not that prestige is particularly amenable to quantitative measurement. At first I suspected she was joshing me, but later a quick internet search revealed it to be the truth!

I am doing this, I am making this happen. Unfortunately the time frame is much too long to fit into the whole lent thing (yes I am doing lent in spite of personal beliefs (or lack of them, rather), because it's just a damn good carrot man), so I had to go with some things that are likely to be way more difficult, but I will pull them off. Then, 3 years from now, I will be staring down that gold medal. My new year's resolutions (yes these are also a mad gay concept, but carrots man, carrots) are also coming along pretty well. As a whole I'm pretty content with 2011 so far. My academic work has improved markedly, I'm socializing more, I'm reading and writing more, shit is so good. I still need to get better at playing along with jokes and such, but I can't do everything at once. I'm not Jackie Stewart like.

Delirious Self-Improvementnasty,
Cathal

entry.title: An investigation into the effect the abundance of Masta Killa has on the quality of a Wu-Tang Clan album
entry.content:
I've proved it! There is a correlation between the number of songs featuring Masta Killa on a Wu-Tang Clan album, and it's quality. I knew it!

In fact, I ran a regression too, and man the correlation up in is mad significant. Most interestingly, a Wu-Tang album with no Masta Killa verses would actually rate off the scale, scoring an average of between 11 and 12. The average Wu-Tang album also loses an average of just over one point per Masta Killa song. And the correlation, as mentioned before, is mad significant, with an R value of 0.99, where 1 is the maximum.

A note on the ratings: They aren't absolute, but rather done in the Ebert fashion. If I judge each album as a piece of work by the Wu-Tang, what would I give it out of ten, with 36 Chambers representing a 10 and the general presence of Cappadonna representing a 0 (originally I was going to run this with Cappadonna appearances, since, unlike Masta Killa, Cappadonna isn't a good rapper, but since he disassociated from the Wu around after The W, it wasn't going to fly). It's also worth mentioning that I don't think Masta Killa is bad. His debut solo album, No Said Date, is one of the best Wu solo efforts of 2000-2004. It's simply an unfortunate yet interesting correlation, between my personal opinion of a Wu album, and the amount of Masta Killa up ins. The decline in quality could also be attributed to the RZA's increasing loopiness, and also that after his five-year plan was over, the group didn't really seem to have the unified direction it had in the early days, when it was dominating everything with great solo albums.

As I've mentioned before, this reflects unfairly on Masta Killa, but I thought it was worth a blog. As atonement for this fronting, I'll encourage you again to get his solo albums. That's all I can do.

DELIRIOUS STATSNASTY,
Cathal

entry.title: A post wherein reaction images are used to convey the duality of my social life (images from Dresden Codak, by Aaron Diaz)
entry.content:
This is Ground State Cathal at a party.


This is Cathal socializing at a party while intoxicated, or not anxious. This is Excited State Cathal. However, unlike the young lady in this image, I do not like coffee, and have never really been in a situation where "wanna get coffee" has been an option on the dialogue tree. Not that I'd like to be, I just cannot stand coffee man it is rancid. I'm not huge on tea either.

Pretty much my main problem is I will pick up on some minor interest a person has that I am hugely into and I will seem way too into it, like I have a shrine to Robert Pollard in my closet or something. Well I mean technically all those cheap beer cans that are going to be in the kitchen tomorrow are a shrine of sorts, so they're half right, but it's not like I'm the one drinking all that Wackenburg (SICK BURN). I should probably ease up on that, since I'd be a fool to think anyone is seriously into American presidents or rap music or bread all that much. Those aren't the kind of people that party. Well maybe the rap dudes do, but like in faded Wu-wear and at battle venues or something. I don't have the requisite Wu-wear to party with those dudes, so I can't party with them.

Cool fact in need of citation: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was once bored, so he wrote to five of his friends, "We have been discovered, flee immediately". One of his friends vanished without trace.

Anyway this post is brought on by my end-of-year Geography assignment, done in groups. For the last one, we were assigned our groups, sweet. But this time, we have to arrange them ourselves. I DON'T KNOW ANYBODY AND I AM NOT GOOD AT TALKING TO PEOPLE. I'm pretty much gonna end up being foisted on some tight-knit bunch of friends (the SF geography class is slightly cliquey), all cramping their style, which will make it even worse. DAMMIT.

As mentioned before, the images are nabbed from Dresden Codak, a very GUD webcomic with some transhumanist undertones. I've blogged about it before, but it's not like any of you actually visited it.

Also, Ground State [Person] is a thing now.

BREVITY!,
Cathal

entry.title: Periphery demographic
entry.content:
So Byron Crawford has been fired from XXL or something. That sucks, I mean the only times I've ever visited the XXL site have been to read his blogs, where he talks about actual rap music, as opposed to blog posts on his own personal site, where he posts noods and Alex Jones stuff. I've actually bought 3 issues of XXL in my life, one out of boredom, and two for the "Making of" section they had, back when The Blueprint was literally the only album I listened to. But XXL finally fired him. It was probably started by that Odd Future post, in which he compared Odd Future to juggaloes, and Odd Future fans threw a shitfit. It was entertaining. Not that I don't like Odd Future, I mean they're good, but some of the overblown rhetoric of fans over here is hilarious. Odd Future are good though, I mean it takes serious skill to sound good over a second-rate Gucci Mane beat. But the hubbub over the article was just even better than usual. Also in the video of their Fallon performance, Jimmy Fallon looks an awful lot like Jimmy Smits. Who was in a dream I had recently. Yeah. In the dream, I complemented his work on Outlaws, a show I have no intention of ever watching. I'm guessing I mentioned it because even dream me has pretty much no knowledge of his work.

I'll miss the extra visibility a blogging gig at XXL afforded Crawford though. It led to so much hilarious butthurt over the years, and all the resultant dears were delicious.

But the point of this post is how XXL have pretty much lost a customer, even though I've never been in their target market in the first place (not being a fan of shit generally). My life as a consumer has been reduced to being in a variety of periphery demographics, doomed forever to be ignored by market researches and be subjected to cut-rate off-model products by feckless license-holders. I think the only target market I'm actually a part of is the "Students" demographic for buying pizza. I'm a big fan of pizza. I'm actually getting some today. It feels nice to be catered to. It's much nicer than the rage I feel every time Equestria Daily posts pictures of the latest off-model palette swap shit.

I mean, damn, they would make a mint from dudes like me who will drop money on on-model Rainbow Dash figures. Apparently they don't even have plans for a Friendship is Magic DVD, even though some of the G1 shit from the '80s is available. I really don't get Hasbro. I get their TV channel, The Hub though. The Hub just doesn't understand that it's easy for syndicated programs to air in running order. The only thing we've lost from this is the original magical-girl concept of FiM that Lauren Faust had, but that might be a good thing, given a) we got a great completely different show out of it, and b) it's still possible there'll be a Milky Way and the Galaxy Girls show or something, after she leaves FiM or it ends or whatever. Which will be at least a couple of years away, since the guy who voices Big Macintosh is in the booth recording lines for (we're assuming) season 3. But it might happen eventually, which would be sweet. Also, tomorrow I am gonna mack on some pancakes.

I have finally managed to make a post about both My Little Pony and rap music, thus isolating absolutely everyone who might ever read this.

Delirious Lentnasty,
Cathal

entry.title: 20 years of good rap music
entry.content:
A couple of years ago, on the A.V. Club I found out about a list making exercise, wherein your favourite album from each year of your life was chosen and listed. I did, and I think I lost it when I deleted my bebo profile, which seems like such a long time ago, but since everytime I blog about music Danish dudes seem to jump on it, I'm gonna get back to one of my favourite subjects-nobody-gives-a-shit-about: rap music.
