entry.title: The Wrong Ball
entry.content:
Normally I wouldn't blog about a dream, I mean mostly I wouldn't remember them long enough to blog about them, but even ones I do aren't really blog-worthy, but this one definitely merits one, since it also leads to a longer thing about FIFA and corruption and all that in general. The dream actually started out as a different thing, where like half of my 13-strong primary school class were in Trinity, and me and this guy in the class above me who went off to play for Man. Utd. went off to play pool in the residence halls. But that was abandoned in favour of a weird thing where Gary Barlow was commissioned to write the World Cup 2010 song for the England team, only to have it banned because the video "disrespected the flag". The dream took the form of a guy who looked like Daniel Craig and who had a double-barrelled surname, interviewing Barlow about it. I saw bits of the video and then in the interview he said the real reason the song was banned is because the balls used in it weren't the official balls of the World Cup. This actually seemed plausible, but off the top of my head the only similar situation I can think of is when Marvin Harrison wouldn't sign a kid's trading card because it wasn't the brand that was endorsed by Marvin Harrison, which at first I thought was weird because he always seemed like a nice guy, but last week I found out he shot repeatedly at a couple of dudes for reasons unknown, and then did a revenge thing when word got out a few months later.

This was gonna be a longer thing about my beef with FIFA, and Sepp Blatter and Jack Warner and their rules about government interference and video refereeing and general corruption, favouritism, and all-around douchebaggery, but I guess you'll have to wait just a bit longer for that, partially because right now I need to brush up on my FIFA douchebaggery, but also right now I'm not pissed off enough to write about it. Maybe next time there's a game-changing decision video-refereeing would have reversed.

[Football term],
Cathal

entry.title: On the changing nature of birthday celebrations
entry.content:
Last July I turned 19 (my birthday is in July so you should mark it on your calendar), and whereas in the past I would do something major for my birthday, this time I just went to see Inception and got a single drink in a pub. That's not to say Inception wasn't crazy awesome, I mean I just fucking love Nolan's movies, and this rivals Memento for, in my opinion, the greatest of them all. But yeah, compared to what I used to do, this was pretty minor, although Mully paying for a cinema ticket is certainly a turn up for the books. I also bought myself the Thief Gold collection, Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri, and Jade Empire, which were all quite a bit of fun, especially Jade Empire, which is a martial arts action-rpg by Bioware, and it's quite awesome. But I thought back to the birthdays I had when I was in primary school, and in fun and event quotient, there isn't really a comparison.

So basically when I was in 10 or so, me and my brother were big into athletics, as were our friends. Generally, the upside of being in a rural primary school is a big fuck-off field for sports at break- and lunch-time, so basically our class and the class above us (with 3 dudes, one of whom went on to play for Manchester United and Triestina), and the class beneath us (several dudes, some of whom Frank knows), played football, and occasionally to shake things up, rugby or hurling of whatever was in at the time. Also, generally, there were several birthday parties a year up until 5th class or so where everyone got invited. You know the deal, birthday cake, coke, 3pm-6pm. One of these is where I played my first Sonic game, and it was good. Sonic had a reputation for that at the time. He doesn't anymore.

But yeah basically one year, my brother organised the most awesome birthday party ever. As I've mentioned before, we were big fans of athletics (I particularly liked Jonathan Edwards, Steve Backley, Javier Sotomayor, and Ato Bolden), and one summer, when the Olympics or World Championships or something were taking place, our friends and came over and we decided to have our own olympics. The good thing about our house and the surrounding area was everything was the perfect distance and layout for dudes our age. We generally just did the long jump, the sprint, a distance race (basically a lap around the house, or 3), a high jump, and something else, but I forget what it is. It was actually great craic, and out of the 5 who usually competed, it was usually a toss up for 3rd between me and Sean, with my brother and Robbie generally taking first and second. I came second once, cos I had insane short-distance speed, which I still kind of do, but not so much. But it was generally great, exhilirating craic, and when my birthday came around, word had gotten out that there would be an "olympics" as such, people were pretty excited. In the end we got like 15 people or so there, enough for heats anyway, and the whole thing was pretty fucking awesome. I think my bro still has the results away in the filing cabinet, so I might dig them out, but as far as I recall I got a top 5 finish.

Gradually, as time went on though, how I celebrated changed, until last year it wasn't even that big of a deal at all. I think for a while I'd go bowling or something, and when I turned 18 I went to Jackies, and then to Mully's house with Fitzy and Darver, where we partook of whiskey, pizza, expired bacon, and Wii Fit, a game that unintentionally calls everyone fat when they first play. But I mean this year it was just like "Inception? Sound". And generally everyone's is going in this direction, where it's just kind of an non-event piss up for the most part, unless there is a free house in which case it's either an awesome piss up, or a completely fucking terrible one (you know the type, generally some dramafriends are there, and shit is stirred). The completely awesome one, on the other hand, involves Liam Neeson kicking ass and dudes that piss you off getting rejected by chicks on the internet.

I guess the point is, that when I was younger, becoming a year older was an absolutely fucking huge deal, but now, it's like so what. It's kind of like that PBF comic, but less morbid. It's like, now a year older only represents an age increase of 5%, whereas back when I was 8 it was like 12.5%, which was fucking huge for a kid like me. I couldn't even count that high on both my fingers! I'm not sure if anyone else is like this, but I just noticed it and thought it might make an interesting post. Also when you were a kid, changing the words to Happy Birthday to "You look like a monkey, and you smell like one too" played like fucking gangbusters.

I'm gonna sing a public domain song next time though, to honour Dan Rydell, who got a mad fine in Sports Night when he sang Happy Birthday on air, and went around asking everyone what pubic domain song they'd like him to sing for their birthday. You should watch Sports Night, if you haven't already. It has the ultimate bromance, and is written by Aaron Sorkin. Plus it's got an awesome cast!

But I digress, this post is really what it says in the title, that aside about Sports Night notwithstanding. But that's about all there is to say on the topic, so yeah, I mean I just thought it was something I should share.

I also got a bike that year, which was fucking awesome,
Cathal

entry.title: McArdle for Councillor
entry.content:
Tonight I went to sleep at 11, and then woke up around 1. I talked to Andrew and Kevin for a bit, and looked at some pictures of that Wagner dude on X-factor that has everyone so mad, and then pretty much I talked to Darver for the better part of 6 hours. Or whatever time the last blogpost went up, cos although we'd been talking for a while before that, this was when the conversation went to McArdle for Councillor 2014.

Basically, we realised that although we liked this idea, we needed some solid numbers. Some research revealed a couple of things.

  1. We need 15 assenters (registered voters in the Ardee area) to sign for Darver's nomination for councillor.
  2. That is, unless he runs for a party, which the Pirate Party would be the most obvious candidate, if they'll have us.
  3. Darver realistically needs 900 votes to get a seat on the council.
We realised, after doing some maths, that this is really possible. A well-managed campaign and some targeted retail politics could get us that easily. Hopefully the Fine Gael government will be well on their way to getting Cowen-level poll numbers by that point, and Fianna Fail will still be hurting from the way they handle the crisis, which means we can hoover up a few swing voters, get people on the basis on both Darver's personality and policies. After a while, of course, we realised more could be done, and we started discussing what would need to be done if Darver were to run for TD. Later we discovered you need to be 21 to run, and with July 14, 2012 as the deadline for the next general election, Darver won't qualify. Balls to that, because we'd done some numbers and realised 1% of the first preference vote was very doable, especially if we could get votes from a) students b) the unemployed c) graduates under 30 and d) disillusioned Green voters and voters from the Father's Rights Party. Basically the whole thing was coming together pretty well, and even though it was unrealistic, it mostly served to increase the awareness of the name McArdle in local politics, which would have helped tremendously in 2014.

We also decided that we could use our friends to fill the key positions in our campaign staff. I'm probably gonna gauge people's interest over the next year or so, and start working on strategies, but ultimately I think we put together a really talented Dream staff, especially the guy we wanted to be in charge of fundraising, and the policy director. I don't wanna say who they are in case they say no, but they'd definitely do a good job.

Also it was realised that Darver could sneak under the radar because he'd be the unknown candidate, and that the major parties probably wouldn't want the bad publicity that comes with smearing an everyman candidate. And even if one man in particular did (hint: he has a impostor twitter), the headline "TEACHER SMEARS FORMER PUPIL" would be a setback he couldn't afford as a rising member of his party. Ultimately, we've realised that with a small group of committed, able people, we can definitely get the 900 votes to put Darver on the council, we just have to execute the game plan. But hey, we have 4 years to prepare.

UPDATES,
Cathal

entry.title: Parish Pumps
entry.content:
An idea that's been floating around in my (admittedly small) circle of friends is the idea of running Darver for Liam Reilly's council seat come the next election. Admittedly it's a good idea, Darver's a pretty sharp guy, and can talk politics and deals with people pretty well. Plus it would be a fun thing to do, right, your friend running for elected office and participating in the process. But then, talking to Darver tonight, I realised how it would be an uphill battle to get him elected, even to a councillor seat. See the first problem Darver's style when talking about politics or the issues involved isn't to simplify it or to take whatever position is popular, but rather to go into some detail and bring a couple of other topics of discussion into it, which I mean first of all is kind of against the traditional Irish political style, and secondly, the reason someone from Fianna Fail, or Fine Gael, or Sinn Fein gets elected in Louth isn't policies or charisma for the most part, it's 90% a family's party loyalty. Basically getting Darver to beat Liam Reilly is an uphill battle. I mean it's not like a really steep gradient, but it'd still take some effort, but I think it would definitely be worth it.

Running on the Pirate Party ticket maybe might be a good idea and get some funding, like enough for some posters and proper local campaigning, but I'm not sure if they've actually registered as a party yet, even though they definitely have enough members. Their TCD branch is already much bigger than the respective Sinn Fein branch, and it's not because everyone there loves their rapidshare and their stealing from hard-working artists. I'm not sure what the point of this blog was, I just wanted to get this down (I'm actually blogging a lot lately, but is that a good thing?) because it's definitely something that should be given a crack, and many hands make light work, et cetera.

Signing off,
Cathal

entry.title: Carpetbagging
entry.content:
So basically during the last week, Arthur Morgan, a dude from Omeath who is a Louth TD, announced he wouldn't be running for re-election. Excellent, I thought, since I had a low opinion of this man. I mean they were probably gonna get Sharkey to replace him, but hey, at least he's gone, I said.

But then, suddenly Gerry Adams decides he wants to run for office in a country he doesn't live in, and, naturally, he's going to do it in the Louth constituency, where Sinn Fein could run the Gambler McCabe and he'd be elected easily. So the newspapers and media are covering it, but nobody's really come down on him for running in a constituency he's never lived in, and has only the most tenuous of connections to. There's an American term for that, carpetbagging, and sadly I haven't heard it, or the underlying concept, mentioned in today's media coverage, which is just saddening. But I think the worst thing is how everyone I ask is reacting. "LOL voting for Adams would be awesome lulz" being the basic gist, which I mean if you're gonna vote for someone cos it would be "awesome" then vote for the Monster Raving Loony Party or, y'know, a candidate and party that could legitimately use that term to describe themselves (Ralph Nader might qualify, but not by any conventional standard of awesome, but he's basically retired now. Bill Bradley would also count, Air Force reservist and basketball hall of famer, who went to Princeton and got a Rhodes scholarship. Doesn't get more awesome than that).

I mean Adams, since he's going to win pretty much by default, will now be the leader of a party in the Dáil. I mean apart from the obvious problems of having someone with such a poor grasp of the key issues and problems currently facing us as Adams with any kind of influence is just a frightening thought, but just as bad is the whole acceptance of this whole deal (which sets up Adams to run at the presidency before the Centenary, where he can lead the glorious parade celebrating some murderers and criminals), and the kind of perception I'm getting that voting for Adams is "awesome". I mean I understand that name recognition is a big deal is helping a carpetbagger get elected, but at least someone like, say, Hilary Clinton or John McCain, had shown intelligence and political acumen, rather than just criticizing the government when they do anything, and then offering policy suggestions that would actually be far worse.

This is pretty much just a rant against Adams the Carpetbagger (that'd be a pretty nice nickname for him to be remembered by) but at the same time, I need to say it, since this whole deal grinds my gears, and knowing that both a) newspapers aren't really going to give much heft to the whole carpetbagger criticism, or even spend a majority of their Adams coverage time pointing out his deficiencies in key areas, and b) knowing that there's nothing I can really do to stop him getting elected, since he is running in Louth, where Sinn Fein is inexplicably popular. Shit sucks, dude.

I mean, really sucks,
Cathal

entry.title: Analogies
entry.content:
The Irish economic policy is a lot like the Oakland Raiders front office. They cut spending where it's crucial, make bad decisions, and spend way more than they can afford on a fat, selfish guy who sucks money away from everywhere else.

That made sense, kind of,
Cathal

entry.title: Multitap, Obsoleted
entry.content:
So a couple of weeks ago, I had some spare change and with it I bought one of those €20 cards for the Playstation Store, mostly because I wanted to get Hustle Kings for some multiplaya with my bro. Instead of sitting on the tenner left over though, I decided to buy this HD remaster of GTI Club, which was one of my favourite coin-ops back in the day, but this new version was absolute bollocks, with about 3 tracks and no local multiplayer, it was just flat out not enjoyable, and I can't get a refund. But the local multiplayer, say for 4 or 7 players or even just 2, would have made it a great game, but without it, it's just flat out terrible.

Hustle Kings on the other hand, is just an absolute joy to play. First off, the minor things: It's got a killer soundtrack, consisting of various generic jazz and lounge tracks (there are also rock and hip-hop and electronica tracks available, but I turned them off because they didn't resonate with my idea of What Pool Should Be) and damn good presentation. You also have to choose an avatar, and you choose from a bunch of "fashionable" dudes and dudettes in their mid-20s, but they all looked like tossers with the exception of one dude who looked just like Tom Hardy, so I went with him, then proceeded to lose my first 5 games or so to AI opponents, but then I figured it out and started owning Easy difficulty opponents. Nothing could stop my ascent, so I decided to play my brother in some local multiplayer (Hustle Kings bucks the prevaling trend by having some goddamned local multiplayer), and the experience playing with another person in the room is incredibly immersive, and feels a lot like actually playing snooker, except sometimes my breaks got into the double digits. So we played it once or so a weekend for a couple of weeks, and this week I decided to hustle online, where at first I got my ass handed to me badly, and then after a few more losses I finally won a game of 9-ball (my opponent then sent me a message saying GG, which takes me back to the days when I was racking up mad achievements and backstabs on TF2). But the main point I'm trying to make is even though on the surface they have the same amount of content, Hustle Kings has literally hundreds of hours more fun within it's archive than GTI Club+, which is the first game I've ever bought that I have regretted buying, and the one I've had the least enjoyment with (I'm someone who bought MTV Skateboarding back as a tot, to give you an idea of the fun abyss GTI Club+ represents).

There are two different places that last paragraph is gonna take me off to, and the first is local multiplayer, and why it's awesome, and why games that don't have local multiplayer are the suxxors. For example, the console version of Civilization (titled Civilization:Revolution), (a game I'm currently having crazy micromanaging fun with on my laptop) which I downloaded the demo for while this blog was on hiatus. I had fun with the demo, which lets you play as Egypt or Rome on a fixed, 5-nation map, and I thought I would maybe buy it at some point, since the games were fun and quick, and there was still a semblance of strategy. Gone, I thought, are the days of hotseat games with my bros that drag on for weeks at a time, now we can simply sit down, grab a controller, and play through the history of human civilization in a single night. But then while finding out more about this intriguing proposition, I found out it came with no hotseat, a game mode that formed the backbone of my early experiences with Civ (in the form of CivNet, don't judge, it came free with my dad's PC), but these days a forum post asking whether or not Civ:Rev had hotseat multiplayer got a response along the lines of "LoL hw wud that work o_O", which caused a great rage to form within me, and then I decided that unless it would going for a Steam Christmas Sale price, like a fiver or so (incidentally what the complete Civ III costs on Steam, go get it) , I would be giving it a large berth.

I should probably at this point give some background, and talk about why local multiplayer is a huge deal for me, and here it goes: basically when I was young, there were 3 bros that were always hanging out with me and my brother. We were all big fans of games like FIFA, and Crash Team Racing (which is still the best racing game going, for my money, Mario Kart can suck it), but at first we only had 2 controllers, and it was still fun, but it meant imposing a winner stays on system with subtracted from the fun. But then, Sony Computer Entertainment, who at the time were infinitely wise, released the motherfucking multitap.

Check out this beautiful motherfucking piece of machinery, Hot Damn!

It was nothing short of a revelation, we rounded up the cash for 2 extra controllers (the DualShock was another awesome thing Sony came up with back then) and suddenly so much fun was being had. See the style of racing games back then was single player would have x opponents, and multiplayer would have x/2 opponents, so it meant the entire field was us, throwing skull bowls and bazookas at each other, and then raging at whoever was lucky enough to get that clock (you know the one I'm talking about). It also had the arena mode, which was even more fun, although some rounds devolved into making walls of potion beakers for shits and giggles. But it was four players so it became more complex and exciting, as rivalries emerged and someone got the 3 bazookas pickup. We could just play it for hours, playing through all the cups, picking on whoever decided to play as Tiny, it was just a flat out amazing game, and it was the multitap that raised from that level to God-like, a status it still holds today, at least with me, my brother, and the denizens of /v/. It was the main game to benefit from the multitap, but there were other games that just went perfectly with it; Nagano 98 for example, a 4-player winter olympics game that was also elevated to stratospheric regions of quality. My only real gripe with it was that it only recorded medals if you "qualified", which was a holdover from the arcade version, I'm assuming, but it meant that you'd go away from some events with nobody or only one person having a medal, and it could accumulate to become really annoying (Athens 2004 would later fix this, and it was also the game where my friend would discover a new technique of button-mashing that made everything that much more exciting). There were other games too, which if you had 5 controllers (which we eventually did), became perfect. NBA Live in particular (this was before the days of the 2k series, and I'm not sure if there were any competitors at the time), where with position lock it became an effort of teamwork and strategy rather than a game of Pass the Fucking Rock to Shaq He Can't Be Fucking Stopped. We created ourselves in game as well, (our heights and weights, understandably, were slightly exaggerated, and in the case of the tallest/largest of our group, extremely exaggerated) and put ourselves all on the same team, and proceeded to tear it up against whatever CPU team had the coolest logo (it wasn't the Cavs I can assure you);

Just look at how ugly this logo is, I mean just look at it.

We won triumphantly every time, except for one occasion when I controlled an entire team, and the other four position locked as themselves, which led to Conspiracy Moment, something which I'll hopefully make a feature of every blog post from here on. Basically my avatar was controlled by the CPU, and he got the ball with the Broballers (they were actually called the jackrabbits or something, you only got a really small set of names to choose from) were 2 points down with 13 seconds to go. I was like "Fuck no" because the Broballers had been pretty good from the field all night, natch. But then my avatar, controlled by the AI, just ran out the clock, just stood there on the edge of the 3-point line, doing nothing, it was fucking weird, but I won, and I don't think anyone noticed my avatar had behaved in a way that had directly benefitted me. I mean had it been a horror game and not NBA Live (Hey, what's the difference between NBA Live and a corpse?) it'd make pretty good creepypasta, I reckon, but it was yet another Awesome Multitap Experience, or AME. I mean that's kind of it for multiplayer games we played, and it might seem like a lot just to play 2 or 3 games, but if you haven't had the brogaming experience that makes it worth it, then man, you missin' out; those multiplayer experiences defined 5th- and 6th-generation gaming for me, and they meant that everyone could be included, rather than having a rotating door system going on w/r/t who got to play. Even on the ps2, we got the new multitap for it, and although Crash Nitro Kart was an absolutely soul-crushing disappointment, and the first legitimately horrible Crash game (aside: When me and my bro were playing through CTR's story mode, our save got erased by a friend at 78%; after a brief moment of agony, we turned around and got full 120% or whatever it was completion lightning fast. In CNK our save was erased at about the same level of progress, and we just said fuck it, and never confronted whatever final boss that game had), we still had awesome games like Athens 2004 (4-player, 26 event olympics is an unbeatable marathon of fun, and when the shooting game comes up, waiting and frustration) and Nightfire: 007, which nerfed Oddjob so much, and had no Klobb. We also gave Madden a go with the multitap, and while it was interesting, the result wasn't really fun, so it didn't last.

But the point I'm slowly reaching is that, thus far, even with online play, I haven't really gotten that kind of thrill from a console game. There are some PC games that frequently reach those levels of fun, but so far on the PS3, Warhawk is the only game I've experienced that is such crazy fun, but it still comes with split-screen multiplayer, so 4 bros can connect to a single server on the same console, which is pretty sweet. MAG might be able to deliver, but I haven't heard enough good things to consider it, and at this point I have no idea how active the online community is. It was this sort of experience that made me love the vidya so much in the first place, and although the ps3 is slowly accumulating some awesome local 3-or-more multiplaya titles, like Scott Pilgrim vs. The World, Joe Danger, Hustle Kings, and Castle Crashers (and also NBA Jam which looks so damn awesome), but there are so many more games that I'd love to be able to play locally (GTI Club+ would benefit enormously from this basic feature) but instead they focus on the online component, which basically means it's impossible to find players 6 months after release in many cases, whereas if they had local MP you'd have some willing bros ready for one more turn, or whatever. I mean you can even have 7 controllers running at once on the ps3, and Civ:Rev would just be amazing with that, but no dice.

I think I promised another section to this post, again inspired by GoddamnTerribleInteractive Club+, which was going to be about games that are great in single-player, but are also fantastic in multiplayer, and it was mainly going to be about SSX, which I played the third instalment of today, but I've already passed 2,000 words in less than an hour (a new My Ace Hen record for longevity and pointlessness I'm sure) which is something I need to do more, since it basically means college will be a breeze in the wind from now on. I'm not even sure what the post was, except nostalgia for playing vidya with bros, but hey that's what it's all about right?

Skull bowls like a motherfucker,
Cathal

entry.title: An Assortment of Dudes
entry.content:
So today Frank told me that it'd been 4 months since I'd put up a new post on My Ace Hen, even though it was scheduled to return 3 months ago, but after the first couple of weeks of delaying and Valve time I started to like the weight of expectation from my readership, I mean Frank expects a lot after such a long wait. I could do it like Jay Electronica, and do a shitty liveblog, and then post excerpts of new posts and ask everyone to be extra nice because I'm sensitive about it, and then it's some cliché shit about chilling with Puffy in Miami and winning a Grammy for the family. That's catchy and all, but compared to what he was doing two years ago, it's pitiful. But he delayed Act II almost a year at this point, and I'm tempted to do the same but I made a forfeit with Frank that if I didn't post tonight, well I'd have to do something that almost certainly would end badly.

But today was pretty interesting, I got home early because my last 2 classes were cancelled due to the National March thing, so my only class today was the Sanders Lab, where he gave us Minstrels and Malteasers to explain the concept of an indicatrix, which is right now the most delicious geological thing going (Feldspar is a close second). But yeah I got home and at about 6 a Garda came around and I agreed to be part of an identification parade, which took about an hour, most of which was spent waiting around holding up a piece of paper with a number on it, and watching people play pool. I also got my mugshot taken, which hopefully will surface when I'm bald to show how badass my beard was. But anyway there were 9 of us in the lineup, 8 people the Gardai had wrangled up from NuBar and Shanowen, and the actual suspect, but they foolishly got a volunteer who looked just like the guy, so the witness ended up identifying one of the volunteers as the man who carried out the plan, and when she did the actual suspect's look of pure joy was a sight to behold. This is one of those Well You Had to Be There stories, but still it was entertaining as hell, and I got a mugshot out of it, and a story to tell whenever there's a lull in conversation. But hey I finished a post after so much dilly-dallying and now I don't have to carry out the forfeit.

Suck It Frank,
Cathal

entry.title: Hiatus: The Return
entry.content:
Basically I'll be taking slightly less than a month off, to do some other things, but also work out what I actually want to do with this blog.

Out,
Cathal

entry.title: Deadlines
entry.content:
This regular updating of my blog is probably a good idea, but at the same time this means its essentially become a non-paying, 3 hours a week job. This means that somehow my supplementals in September will constitute a holiday. After that, I have about 4 weeks until college restarts, and for some reason the college has opted not to implement Christmas exams, despite something like 99% of the student body voting in favour of it. I suppose the one positive is a ridiculously long and stress-free winter break.

Woooooooo,
Cathal

entry.title: Takeaway
entry.content:
Today was pretty much a non-event, I did the usual things. Studied, watched some How I Met Your Mother, searched the internet in vain for a download of El-P's new beat tape, but then at 9 my dad was all "you wanna go for a drive?" and I decided I'd try out Ger's (formerly known as Vinnie's (formerly known as Conor's)) to see what it was like, and also to test its viability as a late night post-entertainment meal option. It was actually pretty solid, the service was a bit slow and the chicken overcooked, but damn those were some good A- chips, just short of Macaris in terms of Irish chips I've had (nobody's gotten an F yet, Wales is another matter). Ger's will certainly have at least a tiny amount of my future "fast food" custom.

Tomorrow I'll stack it up against McDonalds, because August 10th is, in fact, Take Your Love Interest to McDonalds Day, the second actually. The first being when that guy took a girl to McDonalds after a movie, then she didn't answer his calls, and he wrote a long missive about Bitches and Whores Man because she expected somewhere not-McDonalds. It was also the real start of moot's long hate affair with /r9k/, which for a brief period was a good board, and after the Alpha as Fuck Transformice incident, might actually reach that peak again someday. But generally I've been avoiding 4chan since it's summer and unfunny summerfags are out in abundance. Highlight of what I've seen: Guy on /g/ asking for a kick-ass gaming computer for "$400".

Hell, this blog post cost more than that.

War out,
Cathal

entry.title: The Trillest to Ever Trill
entry.content:
I was gonna try and do some skewering of Bun B (the alive half of UGK) and The Source because they gave him 5 mics and made a huge deal out of it to try and get some sales. They even had a "GUESS WHO WE HAVE 5 MICS TO" poll, to create some non-existent suspense. If they'd done it back in the era of The Chronic and Illmatic (there's like a year and half separating them, but that's the kind of contest that people would actually be interested in, mostly because of the East/West thing going on) maybe they could have had even bigger circulation numbers, but, I mean, it's 2010, if you asked Everyone Who Read the Source Between 1991-1994 if The Source still existed, most would be like "It exists, really?" when you told them. It was basically some NME-style posturing, except The Source is a rare music magazine that manages to be worse than NME (see also: Alternative Press, Rolling Stone, Hot Press), but I think I may already have touched that base back before I even had a beard.

The album also has Drake, which automatically disqualifies it from 5 mic status, but how was giving Bun B 5 mics supposed to resuscitate The Source anyway (I mean anyone could tell this was a poorly planned CPR attempt right)? It just makes it worse, now that rating is even more worthless, cos at least when Lil Kim got 5 mics for The Naked Truth everyone knew it was because her managed banged the Harvard guy who used to run it. Hopefully this hastens its downfall, fingers crossed it won't even exist in a few months, although even going the way of Blender would be acceptable.

Interesting google result: "The Source wiki" doesn't even return a result for the magazine on the front page. Honestly, Guy Who Runs The Source as a Vanity Publication, are you even trying?

I want 108 mics,
Cathal

entry.title: The Toaster and the Cooker
entry.content:
I was meant to go see Inception tonight, but Fitzy's dad went to play golf so ultimately I decided I'd roll along to the store where two local METUL KVLT bands were playing and one was launching an E.P., but I was all nah, plus I didn't have a whole lot of money, so basically I chilled with Frank and this guy from my primary school, Kevin, who is now a complete legend. Also Ryan and Emma were there, those guys are pretty cool.

So we just chilled out and ordered some pizza and shit was fun yo, a solid bro's night even though a chick was there (=[!), and I met Frank's cousin, and learned that Frank's broctitis is genetic, since his cousin was a similarly misogynistic but pretty sound dude, and he told me a pretty cool story about him and the Ass Tattoo Guy from my first grad night (The Toaster and the Cooker story of the title), who a year later shouted at Darver in the Williamson's Mall car park. I related the story of the Jug of Sick in return, since I realised it's a much better story than Psychobitch, which although it's enjoyable, doesn't really have a great structure and is thus low-tier anecdote. There are other good stories in my repertoire, but they're really more like minor distractions than the centerpieces that get people huddled around, but it's better that way. I'm glad I went out though, shitrox bro, the Store is a pretty chill place and I totally dug the vibe. This post actually required a lot less effort than previous ones, maybe the My Ace Hen comeback begins here.

Tune in on the 7th, where I make tortured comparisons between Bun B and some wrestler, and also skewer The Source with my razor-sharp wit!

Frank has nobeard,
Cathal

entry.title: The Old, Good Posts
entry.content:
I've realised that this blog has basically fallen into one. Man I've fallen off harder than mid-80s Bob Dylan, but hopefully soon I can basically hook up with Daniel Lanois and make a decent post and then fuck shit up with Slash and Don Was and some other dudes then cover some folk songs and then eventually return My Ace Hen to its double-digit readership heyday, when posts didn't have any discernible point or subject matter and resembled walls of text out of bad vidya webcomics. But the internet moves so fast that I can actually call my early-Summer posts "The Old", even though it probably takes a whole season for Dane Cook to come up with something.

Brand new day,
Cathal

entry.title: Dust
entry.content:
When I was a kid, I used to love the end of a box of cereal cos it meant I got to top off the bowl with all the crushed flakes/grains/multi-grain rings which were so baller, but today I was at the end of a box of Rice Krispies and I just threw it away, even though that dust was still there. 6-year old me was probably just looking at me tearing up because I was throwing away what was basically Morning Dessert, except it was extra special because it was rare, like those shiny pokémon, or that baseball card that says Fuck Face on the bat.

I'm not even sure where I was going with this post, but pretty much it came from a series of conversations with Fitzy and Frank about people we used to roll with but now we just have animosity with. I had an idea about a long extrapolation of that, using the cereal dust thing as a kind of tortured metaphor, but I just couldn't start it in any quality way, I might revisit it later, but right now I mean it's pretty hard to write a lot about people you don't really keep in touch with.

It's a work in progress,
Cathal

It's a big milestone for a blog, since most get abandoned after the first few posts. The real Milestone Post is being saved for the 100th post, which should be in early November, but it'll probably just end up being a Hallowe'en blog.

Hallowe'en's pretty cool though,
Cathal

entry.title: Media Server
entry.content:
I've finally caught up fully on How I Met Your Mother, and just in time too since Season 6 starts in 2 months. It's a fantastic show, and the cast is awesome, I mean it's got Neil Patrick Harris AND Jason Segel, it even had Nick Swisher for an episode, and that dude is a total bro. Season 5 was a huge letdown though, they totally wasted the awesome Barney-Robin shit and it just overall wasn't as funny, I mean there were periods where I wasn't laughing. Season 2 just wouldn't have let that happen. Season 5 did have that awesome musical number and The Playbook, but overall it still doesn't compensate, but whatever, it's an awesome show that you should watch.

Next up on my Shit to Put In My Shared Videos Folder is Treme whenever I download it, and the new episodes of Futurama, of which I've watched the first two. The first one was disappointing (you just can't best an opening shot of Hypnotoad), and the second one was pretty enjoyable, and had much Zapp Brannigan. At least Fox didn't get a chance to molest it, that would have been unpleasant, although thankfully they're too busy giving Seth MacFarlane money to come up with unoriginal, unfunny shows.

His shit legitimately sux yo,
Cathal

entry.title: Bropad
entry.content:
My resits are in just over a month, so I need to study harder for them, and pass and move on into second year and chill with Larney in our kicking and happening Shanowen flat with either Aoife or 2 people we don't know.

Then, in 3rd year, I move with Operation Bropad, which is basically a low-budget version of the dream accomodation Mully and Darver talk about, except probably without hammocks, what if they creak and I can't sleep because of the noise. Plus hammocks in the winter just kills the vibe, I mean, Christmas hammocks? But basically a wireless external hard drive for the sharing, and also a decent sized TV plus streaming HD tv onto it from my laptop via the awesome combination of Homegroup + PS3, seriously, shit is the bomb. I've almost finished How I Met Your Mother thanks to it.

It's awesome,
Cathal

entry.title: Backlog
entry.content:
I've allowed things to pile up this week, including blog entries, but most importantly the new Arcade Fire album, which is actually out in like a week so I'll probably, in some kind of gesture I don't know the meaning of, wait until the physical release to actually listen to it.

It'll probably be awesome though,
Cathal

entry.title: Niamh's Gaff
entry.content:
I went to Niamh's party last night, and she's 17 next week, it was a week early for reasons I don't actually remember, but I'm in Dublin the actual day of her birthday so it all works out for me in terms of celebrating my friend's birthday. But it was way out in this place called Reaghstown, and we used a really cheap Lidl/Aldi GPS to get us there, which, while it named every townland in Cooley, prompted my dad to espouse his theory that the GPS dudes know who everyone is.

But to the actual party, I'm actually writing this like 3 days later so I'm sketchy on the details, but I saw Eimear for the first time in ages so that was mad fun and I was like hells yeah, and I chilled with Charles and we discussed how Nas and Rivers Cuomo are really the same in terms of career arc and also music quality (more on this in a later post). Most of the night however was spent at a kitchen table with some Ardee dudes and Shane Byrne, while this dude named Gerry was being a hater and hating on the Beached Whales, and then I talked to this other guy about Queen and hitting on people. Also worth mentioning is some bros who acted in a very un-brolike fashion. I am disappoint, bro, you know who you are. It was actually an awesome party though, despite the gaggle of Drunk 16-Year Olds Coming to Realizations About Themselves, and a lot of good minor shit went down, and minor shit is the best.

Laid back,
Cathal

entry.title: Darv's Gaff
entry.content:
Last night was definitely the best time I've had so far this year, top 3 at least. I mean it was also completely unexpected, which makes it more awesome. Normally I dig on a house party a decent amount to begin with, but like all Darver Gaff Parties are usually pretty good, but this one, with the exception of Kavanagh Self-Inviting Himself Goddamn Man Why Are You Here? it was pretty fucking awesome, all my favourite dudes (excepting Frank) were in attendance, and also I schooled Noonan and Kavanagh in FIFA, 6-2 and 5-0, and they can suck my dick, cos I'm a shaaaaaaaark.

Eh there was a lot of other fun shit done, chilling with Fiacre and Fitzy, but also pretty much everyone huddled around Steve's laptop on Stickam, which was hilarious at the time, and it was even better because Kavanagh got "tomato'd" like 3 times in 5 minutes, whereas true bros like Fitzy and Colly and Bill was all up in. We also watched Taken which is fucking awesome, it's basically Liam Neeson bitch-slapping the world for a while. Darver also has minstrel figurines for some reason, but I can't even begin to guess. I'd write a longer post but eh I'll probably edit this one later to give it more structure and plot.

Minstrels, man?
Cathal

entry.title: Money in the bank
entry.content:
It was a pretty dull weekend really, mostly I played Jade Empire, which so far has been pretty good, even if it basically wastes the morals system, which at first sounds really interesting and complex but in the end turns out to be Open Palm = Angel, Closed Fist = Satan Spawn, but the martial arts is hella fun, as is beating the crap out of drunk outlaws and Gao the Lesser. The writing's pretty solid and the game's immersive, so I'll probably have one long session that gets me like 2/3 of the way through the game, I've also gained some Ice power, but I haven't really used it yet, since the basic Legendary Strike thing is working well so far, even against what are basically bosses.

I've also seen Inception twice, and holy shit it's fucking good. When I first heard about it the news came around the same time the Jonah Nolan-Spielberg wormhole movie was announced, so far a while I kinda conflated them, but I still wanted to see it, because pretty much just Chris Nolan, who makes some fucking great films, Insomnia is probably my least favourite, and even that is fucking good. But eh yeah the film was actually really fucking fantastic, and I'll probably see it at least once more, since I have a pretty good idea of what's going on, but I just need to confirm it. The soundtrack's also pretty sweet, and Johnny Marr plays the guitar parts.

I didn't really do much else this weekend, I went to the Store briefly on Friday and Kevin and Lucy gave me a kick-ass homemade gift, and I wanna thank them again, then I talked to Kevin's friend Carl about shit for about an hour, and it was pretty entertaining, even if I was incapable of sticking to a single conversation thread. I don't have much lined up for this week though, Niamh's having a house party on the weekend, so I'll probably go to that, and also Toy Story 3.

Bubi,
Cathal

entry.title: A long-ass post to kick off a long-ass year
entry.content:
It's 0:04, and I'm celebrating my 2nd day of being 19 by helping Darver troll someone in Silence although it initially started out as Darver overthinking replies. I doubt the person he's texting reads this so I can say that Darver is not actually passed out on the benches below (no homo).

I'm also reading Steve Albini's diary of the final Big Black tour (http://petdance.com/actionpark/bigblack/tourdiary/) which is really entertaining, and short so it's perfect for internet users everywhere! I'll side with that group, I just can't read things with page counts in the triple digits in .pdf format, I may have read chemistry notes like that but that's different, it's really like a series of 8 page historical short stories, except in 400 years cinema won't have made them seem hilariously inaccurate. I was legitimately bummed out when I found out vikings didn't have those horns. It's a good thing I don't have the Tyrant's Helm, I would've been tempted to craft it, like that Free Weekend Kid who was pissed he kept getting hats. I raged. TF2 IS ALL ABOUT THE HATS, THEY'RE THE ESSENCE OF TF2. Fitzy has not played TF2 that much since hats were introduced, and I'd join him if they weren't a complete cocktease that I just can't say no to. The camera beard did not sate me, and the mining light doesn't even do anything when you press the 'f' key.

I also read a very interesting piece about Antichrist Kotick, and it managed to lower my opinion of him somehow, even though he was already in the same circle as Martin Sludden, The Dude Who Cancelled Arrested Development, and Ubisoft's DRM. I was shocked at how he actually is completely comfortable with saying he wants to take the fun out of making video games, or he only wants Activision to publish games that can have Guitar Hero levels of over-exposure. The Starcraft II stuff was maybe the worst. Although previously I didn't really give a shit outside of bisu I am now rooting for Starcraft 1 to remain Korea's national sport. Activision make a thing out of charging people for what should be basic out-of-the-box services, but I guess when your company is run by dudes who hail from Nestle or Proctor & Gamble, out-of-the-box means nesquik rather than, say, LAN Play, or a dev console, or dedicated servers.

And tomorrow I get to see Inception, a movie so intriguing Mully is actually going to pay money to see it, which enforces my argument that piracy results from apathy rather than whatever the RIAA blames it on, I can't even remember, I just remember the horrible maths they used. Gabe Newell said something, like piracy is only a concern if you're putting out shit. I completely agree. I've bought pretty much every Valve game except L4D1 that they've put out in the last 5 years. By comparison, I've bought one UbiSoft game, and it was used, and it was Michel Ancel and he's an exception to their Rule of Crap. I'll be going to the Store too, and there should be a few people there, and hopefully Eimear if I don't make it to town at 1, it's been way too long.

I got Jade Empire anyway, and also the Thief Collection and Alpha Centauri (which runs on Linux, the RMS trolling begins), which was a pretty good deal for 30 quid, compared to Steam prices (the barometer of value), and I picked up The Force Unleashed for my bro used, 12 quid, which raises my PS3 games count to 7, which is 7 more games than the PS3 actually has. I was intending to watch Jackie Brown today too, but between the haircut and the Magee's Bistro (steak was completely underdone, but still good, although first time it's been less than perfect), and the losing 4-1 as Spain to New Zealand in a FIFA match against my bro, it got lost in the shuffle. I'll put it on tomorrow probably, after I cram some Soils up in. Read the Democrat too, in the barber's today, but the observations I mined are going to saved and stewed for another post, when more perspective is available. I'm not sure what my parents have against the Democrat, maybe because they put the Lordship news in with Cooley? That's really all I could think of, the journalism itself was pretty solid, which is the first time I've been able to say that about a publication in a while, I mean Uncut is good, but mostly it's pretty unremarkable C+ standard stuff, although they had a really good article about Bitches Brew period Miles this month, which somehow made Miles Davis even more badass, a shame he had to be a prick about getting $50,000 upfront for a Miles-Hendrix session, I mean how fucking great would that have been?

Guided by Voices Classic Lineup have also announced a tour, but there's no chance I'll be able to make it. I'd punch a bear and shit to go, but it's not gonna happen, but it's ok because I have the Bala's Birthday bootleg, although I still haven't heard The One Where Bob Offers the Soundman a Blowjob, or even Relaxation of the Asshole, which makes me a pretty shitty fanboy, I don't even have his Soderbergh soundtrack.

!Checo Esos Doubles,
Cathal

entry.title: Free as in freedom
entry.content:
Today is my last day of being 18 I think, and it's like 11:33 so it's less than half an hour. I'd do a long-ass sentimental as fuck recap but nah plus I'm not sure what I'd include or exclude I mean I could be here quite a while, but eh basically today was actually pretty good. Yesterday I was in town too and I ended up talking to Shane Byrne and Jack mostly, but also Ri and Niamh and Sarah.

But today I came in primarily to look at phones, but I don't really see much of a point in upgrading, the HTC Desire looked good but the price was prohibitive, so I'm gonna stick with the reliable, servicable 3410. Then I met Frank and watched him gay it out with yet another dude, and then pretty much just bummed around as always, little was done. I was going to get my hair cut but there was an insane queue, so I just got the bus and read Uncut, which is pretty much the only music-related thing I really read nowadays, except for Bol's Saturday Night Workout, which is fantastic. I've also installed an Ubuntu partition on my laptop, so I might do some blogs where I troll RMS by loading my laptop with propietary software and talking about how great open-source is.

Tomorrow is dinner with my fam anyway, good times, and then Friday I'll see Inception with my bros, and go to the Store, looking forward to it.

I'd like to interject for a moment,
Cathal

entry.title: Cathal's Gaff
entry.content:
Eh I stayed at home and watched the Louth/Meath match, and saw some absolutely horrible refereeing, then afterwards, some spineless behaviour. First off Joe Sheridan talking about how it was such a great goal, then RTE News not even mentioning the nature of the goal, and presenting the story as essentially Butthurt Louth Fans Can't Handle Their Defeat By a More Commercially Attractive Team, although the Sunday Game was spot on, and props to Eamonn McGee in the Irish Independent, for pointing out true justice would be giving the title to Louth, since this was unambiguously Louth being robbed of the title with a bullshit 'goal' that was also the last touch of the game. The behaviour of a few Louth fans afterwards ain't the issue, and you all fucking know it. Also Meath fans need to stop whining about the ref being totally Louth-biased throughout the match, they got the exact same number of calls as Meath. But yeah I just really mad. Mad at Sludden, mad at Sheridan, mad at the umpires, mad at the Meath manager and the Meath county board, and mad at Christy Cooney.

If it goes down how I expect it to and Meath chicken out and hand the matter over to the GAA (who they know won't give a replay of their own accord) then there needs to an absolutely fucking huge asterisk beside the 2010 Leinster title.

I REALLY MAD.

Stop Whinin', Stop Lyin',
Cathal

entry.title: Christine's Gaff
entry.content:
So yesterday was meant to be Day Two of Broxegen but I was mad sick so I had to skip it, apparently I missed some unusually homoerotic Ro-Frank shit but I would just have spent most of the night doubled over so y'know it was everybody's gain. But today I wasn't sure if anything was happening, so I was preparing for a night of Dinosaur Comics and brochat when Christine called me and was like "Do you wanna come down dude?" and then 10 minutes later Larney rang asking me if I had anything that would let them play films off a hard drive on a tv, so I got my HDMI cable and packed it along with my small external, which had Sims 3 which I was going to give to Christine.

When I got there though, they weren't even watching films, they were having a states-naming contest, and then me and Christine had a conversation about Achewood, which she's finally up to date on (if you're reading this, you should read Achewood, but not the most recent one, just click random comic as soon as possible), and we tried to work out who was like who, but didn't get much further than Darver = Ray, although I see myself as kind of a Teodor or Chuckle Bot, although secretly I want to be Cornelius, like probably Teodor does.

But eh we ended up deciding after much deliberation and the arrival of Frank to watch The Dark Knight, which is some compelling shit, props to Nolan, I am sure Inception will be great, that dude knows how to make films. But after we paused it to go into the kitchen to get drinks we ended up talking for a while and just not resuming it, it was actually seriously good to get together with my bros and talk in a dark room for a couple of hours, it brings me back to that night in the Dutch House when that car pulled up outside, and we rushed to turn off all the lights. We ended up just talking about all kinds of things, and I also outlined my Prequel Trilogy to Kevin, and even he agreed that it was phat, so I might actually y'know write it down at some point. Eventually they went home so I was like giving the Sims 3 ISO to Christine, and then we had a Tetris contest that I lost horribly, I am just not good at that game. Apparently me and this other person also have similar fringes, although maybe that's a Christine Metaphor I don't get. But tl;dr, Christine is seriously awesome, a true bro.

Also I found out the Trinity Library was the inspiration for the Jedi Archives in Star Wars, much of yes, and also I have the Star Wars font on my PC. Shit is good.

Tomorrow I have a free house since my parents and bro are at the match, so I'll have Cathal's Gaff up Monday, although it'll probably just be 500 accounts of me getting high on brick cleaner and cussing the couch.

Oh, also Brofist to Charles and Niamh.

I only sniff double brick cleaner,
Cathal

Eh today was pretty solid, I'm completely crippled with these horrible abdominal pains, but I went into town anyway cos it was Broxegen, and I met Ri and Feargal and we hung out for a while and then Frank showed up, and we got some food, and walked to Ri's, which is where I found out about a true bro called Sean. Basically we were watching this show called Underage And Having Sex and one of the story threads was a relationship between this ginger bitch and her new boyfriend, this total bro who works out and wears hats, called Sean, I missed the end, but Sean was a gentle soul and although he was mad, he was like Am Sorry, shit was inspirational, I should write more, but I'm just in too much pain to do so.

Argggghhhhh,
Cathal

entry.content:
I'm home, there isn't much to add, there was some turbulence on the plane ride home but that was about it, hovering above the clouds was pretty beautiful too.

Signing off,
Cathal

entry.content:
Eh I didn't really do much today, I had a bath and listened to some new music, and read more Questionable Content (I'm like halfway through it now, although I'm reading backwards and apparently the early strips aren't worth reading, so the fraction is a bit larger), and pretty much just chill out and also browse /mu/'s share threads for things I might like, and also 2010 albums I missed out on, like Portugal. The Man, and Two Door Cinema Club and Los Campesinos, which if I recall was Mully's first 2010 album. I liked their first two so I don't know why I'm only getting it now. Bread's good though,
Cathal

entry.title: Monaco
entry.content:
Eh this is my first post of July, which means my birthday is like 2 weeks away, but also I'm halfway through Cathal Goes to France, although yesterday technically I wasn't in France but in a neighbouring principality! Monaco!

It was so cash, I saw lots of cool shit, and also went to the oceanographic museum, although it was like 30 degrees and it felt like a giant frying pan, also the train was really good too. Then I got home and slept for hours, also my camera was out of battery so I don't have any photos. The aquarium was pretty awesome and I saw pretty much all the sights, while listening to this catchy muzak-funk riff which was total easy-listening avenue. I'd do a longer post about it but I'm way too exhausted.

Today I went to this burger bar as such, called le 86, and I had the best burger ever. Then I went to school and got an A. Born in the U.S.A. I've also been listening to El-P's Bieber remix for the last half an hour, holy shit this is banging. El-P should remix all those popular artists I can't stand, he has a pretty good track record with it.

Also my favourite band ever, Guided by Voices, are doing a reunion show for the Matador Records anniversary party, and it's the lineup with Tobin Sprout and Greg Demos, and also Kevin Fennell and Mitch Mitchell, who I thought was missing? I guess money brought him out of hiding from his job as a fry cook in Oregon. It should be pretty good, although if it's not a one-off thing then I MAD, cos Bob was all Nah I won't reform GBV now, that cheats the fans, that's something The Who would do! It'll be great though, Pollard's back on top form recently, We All Got Out of the Army has been one of my favourite albums this year.

And the Engineer update is finally on its way, ALMOST EVERYTHING IS COMING UP CATHAL!

Also, eh Rammellzee is dead, rest in peace dude, you were always a true visionary bro.

Have you looked at what I found?
Cathal

entry.title: Zidane
entry.content:
France is actually pretty sweet, the forecast was all clouds and storms but it's sunny and humid, although maybe a bit too humid so I'm only comfortable outside if I'm in the pool itself, other than that it's all good, 3 of my 5 meals have been pizza so it's like I'm really back at college. Shanowen Spar had these awesome 99c cheese pizzas which cooked in 10 minutes and were just really nice. I also have internet access (natch) so I have downloaded Office 2010 and Big Boi's and Kele's solo albums, I haven't listened to The Boxer yet but Big Boi's is actually really good and solid. Shutterbugg in particular. I haven' t watched any French TV yet, although I have had shit loads of French bread, with some absolutely god-tier butter, which is just so good man.

I guess I don't have much else to write about yet, since France has diverted me from analyzing my Situations, and tomorrow I'm getting the train to Monte Carlo, which will be pretty sweet although I won't be able to afford anything there probably.

Also I wanna do the Au Revoir signoff cos Cantona did it in that awesome 90s ad, not cos I'm suddenly in touch with French culture now, I mean I've forgotten most of the French I learned in school.

[Cathal pops his collar]

Au revoir,
Cathal

[He takes the penalty, it is successful]

Although it turns out I didn't actually totally call it, but at least I still have my last 16 calls to rest my laurels on. entry.title: Toning down the esoteric rap talk
entry.content:
Friday, Frank told me that he didn't really understand all the talk about rap music I have in my blog, and he was like if I explained it all through wrestling analogies it would be cool, but I can't really think of a lot of those, except Drake = A less talented Cena, so I'll probably just remove it entirely until I come up with more, then I'll be back to talking about a genre nobody really gives a fuck about anymore, with a vengeance!

But eh what I actually did this weekend, I went out! Twice! I went to The Store on Friday, the Thieves were launching their EP, they're alright, better people than musicians, y'know? I talked to a few people, but none really at length, and I'm pretty sure I pissed Sarah off in a huge way, but I can't really ask her Y U MAD THO? without making it worse. I went to Macs the next night, and there was nobody there at first, so I talked to Starkie (one of the Original Leads) and then 2 members of my Wolfpack and Emma showed up, and we got some delicious discounted Domino's Pizza, although I didn't have a huge appetite, I was just needed somewhere to go, The Reformed Trends/Hot Stuff played, and they were pretty tight, although Macs isn't a great setting when there's only 7 people watching the band. It's still about 7 times more than I expect for the first gig Me, Frank, and Eleanore put on (I'm split between whether Ri or Christine would be the only attendee, shit, maybe we'd get a massive crowd of 2), but I went to the smoking area and chilled out. Not much really happened anyway, I dunno, Ri was also there, but mostly I chilled with Neil and Emma, and, later on, Shane Byrne! I see those guys a lot, but it's not a problem cos they're pretty cool and don't afraid of anything, also Shane Byrne is in my Wolfpack.

I had more written about a concern I had, but it was a) trite as fuck and b) way too baring of the emotions. I'll get someone's counsel on it later, and see how I should approach shit, although I should probably just let it go, I dunno.

Also, I'm doing the Yes Man thing for the month of July, feel free to hit me up for degrading favours.

RAIN ON YOUR DREAM FIELD,
Cathal

entry.title: Summer Forest
entry.content:
Not much has been going on today, except I've got 117% on Spyro: Year of the Dragon. I've played the first 3 recently (I might do a Let's Play of Enter the Dragonfly at some point, but I'm not sure I could handle the terrible frame rates and the sub-RTE 3d graphix. 2 is definitely my favourite, it has hella solid characters, and although the writing doesn't touch Ratchet and Clank, it's still pretty enjoyable. The music for 2 is also beyond God tier, the homeworld themes are these incredibly chill ambient pieces, which sadly weren't imitated for YOTD, which instead has pretty fast paced pieces which don't suit my cycles. Hurricos is also brilliant, on some Warp Records shit, the rest is solid too, but those 3 pieces are in my rotation something serious, along with MURS, who I've listened to a bit in the past, but I put on The End of the Beginning a couple days ago, and holy shit, it's good. My summer soundtrack has become Jay Elec, Ghostface, and MURS, some solid chill rap music. Times is good. Going out Friday and Saturday, and then talking to myself on Sunday with some Hey Arnold.

Rugged like Rwanda,

Yes hetero,

entry.title: Detox
entry.content:
Back in the 80s, there was this rap group called N.W.A, there were 5 dudes in it, although all the music and lyrics were done by 2 guys: Dr. Dre, and Ice Cube. After the group broke up, Ice Cube briefly became a provocative rapper making great albums like AmeriKKKa's Most Wanted, and Death Certificate, but after the L.A. Riots, he slowly started becoming the new Bill Cosby. You can catch him in a family movie in a cinema near you every few months.

The other guy, Dr. Dre, was a producer mainly, but he was also a pretty bad rapper who sounded like Slick Rick (the British guy with the eye patch). He produced The D.O.C.'s album while he was with N.W.A, it was awesome. Then that same guy told Dr. Dre he should make a solo album, so he strongarmed people into writing him lyrics with hilarious insults (Gap in your tooth, so my dick's got to fit, etc., etc.) and although the production was up to the usual awesome standard, a new protege called Snoop Doggy Dogg was really the only reason to listen, then he produced Snoop Dogg's debut album, which was awesome. 6 years later, he signed Eminem, and put out a slightly better album, 2001, where his rapping was actually listenable. Eminem put out 3 fantastic albums with him aswell, and then they both seemingly lost their touch.

Even though I had no real reason to be hopeful, I still had pretty high expectations for Dr. Dre's 3rd solo album, Detox, which he's been working on for about 10 years now, but then yesterday the first single leaked, featuring Jay-Z, which was just awful. He'd played a segment of a Detox track on a Dr. Pepper ad (?) and it sounded alright, but this was awful, the rhymes were sub-Blueprint 3 (bad jokes and punchlines and references) and the music was Fruity Loops style.

Dr. Dre, I am disappoint,
Cathal

entry.title: Duck Tales! Ah woo-ooh!
entry.content:
The current frustrating thing of the moment though is Toy Story 3 coming out in 3 days in the U.S., but on July 16th here, I mean that's a day after my birthday so fucking A! but I also have to avoid /co/ and /tv/ for the next month, and I love those boards! They alerted me to the current state of the Lantern corps (The Green Lantern was never a character/concept I was huge on, it seemed more unbalanced than Superman, and his weakness was even more ridiculous, I mean the colour yellow, word?), and also my favourite superhero ever, The Sentient Maths Equation! Also included is a sentient box, those comics are seriously fucked, although the box is still better than Larfleeze.

I also had to replace my awesome Sennheiser headphones, but I ended up getting the same pair again, except I chose to buy the same pair, unlike TF2 where I get the same weapon over and over and over even though a hat would be cool not that it's a big deal but I'd dig a hat. Not much else is going on though, since most of the people I hang out with are doing the leaving, I need to set up a homegroup, but I still need to backup everything I want to keep. So mostly I've been chilling, and reading geography textbooks. I had this absolutely horrible dream, but I can't really blog about it. North Korea are playing soon enough so I'm gonna check that out and see how badly they do or if they manage to not humiliate themselves.

Anchors away,
Cathal

entry.title: Jar of Jam, Ton of Bricks
entry.content:
So I got this delicious looking pink bun (I used to call them monster buns when I was a kid) and I was just looking forward to enjoying it with a delicious glass of milk, and when I took my first bite the centre had no delicious jam! It was just cream! I mean it was still good, I finished it and everything, but it was disappointing, it was like when Weezer reformed without Matt Sharp, except the bun was still palatable! I dunno what the deal is especially since fresh strawberries and raspberries are in abundance I must express my disapproval of this development, the powerful cream lobby must have gotten hold of them. The press should do something about this.

They should also do something about John Boehner being all supportive of the idea that the Federal Government should pay for the BP cleanup, and also of the idea that making BP pay is somehow harmful to capitalism. Fuck them. The Irish Independent could benefit from good journalists from example, and less advertorials, although I appreciate that a paper needs to pay the bills, charging 600 for a job advert should do that, right? It's a changing environment and all, but why papers aren't taking pointers from the San Francisco Panorama, which is pretty much like Pele and Michael Jordan crossbred and put into newspaper form, oh God, I wouldn't know where to start. Basically it has long form journalism and great comics and photography and all these things that would make me buy a paper, I used to read the Independent for Dilbert, but now "Newspaper Comics" is absolute shit like Girls & Sports, or Nemi, with some occasional greatness from Cul de Sac, which doesn't get enough exposure considering how fantastic it is. National newspapers are pretty much fucked though, but there's still going to be a market for local papers, I mean Dundalk manages to support 2 (technically 3), but in the U.S. there are cities with huge populations that can't support more than one. A paper is still preferable to having to rely on exclusively online news sources, most of them are atrocious, like WorldNetDaily, or hilariously naive and irritating, like the Huffington Post.

YEAH BOI,
Cathal

entry.title: Print
entry.content:
I'm just back from the Blessing of the Graves which was alright, the weather was perfect we didn't have to do it in an undersized church or have it rain down halfway through, although there was more of the weird skirting around the scandal, but referencing it at the same time, which is just awkward for everyone.

I got mad new music up in too, I got the discographies of Living Legends, the Residents, Sam Cooke, and the Streetlight Manifesto, although I haven't heard the last band and I'm just going on /mu/'s recommendation, and although that may seem foolish, introducing me to Emancipator buys you a lot of leeway. I don't really read that many music magazines anymore though, online or print, sometimes I'll buy Uncut, but even that's just 4 times a year, and maybe XXL twice. The difference is Uncut is genuinely enjoyable though, XXL is more like hanging out with your old friend who is now pretending to like a lot of annoying pricks because they give him money, although he still has more dignity than the Source, which is the lowest a magazine can get. XXL just really doesn't give a fuck anymore though, like in 97 Funcrusher Plus could get press from magazines (Look, I know they were funded by James Murdock and Rawkus at the time, but they'd been generating heat before they had that) but now even Madvillain's new album or a Can Ox return would get maybe a paragraph beside the adverts for "liquid trust", because, at heart, all heads are insecure about their girls. I'll pick it up the week the Camu Tao album finally drops, just to see if they mention it at all. They probably won't. But they have plenty of room for trying to make us think Soulja Boy is a serious artist, or that Asher Roth isn't complete dirty bongwater. Or when I picked it up one time and they talked about how Charles Hamilton was so emotional and complicated, when it was completely obvious he was low as a snake and couldn't rap. You can also see every edition of the Freshmen 10 for this, although this year's wasn't too bad by comparison, J. Cole, Freddie Gibbs, and Wiz Khalifa are all people whose debut albums I'll be downloading, but then there's B.o.B. and Ace Hood and Asher Roth, who are only on those lists because their labels paid for it. But yeah...

I also have the Dark Cloud ISO on my drive, and I'm really hyped about playing that, I had the demo disc back when I got a ps2, and we used to have races to see how far down the dungeon you could get in the time the demo allotted before it went back to the demo selection screen. I'll probably play Shenmue too, cos driving a forklift is like a life-long dream for me, and I can't wait to play a simulation of it.

This is how we do it in the 10s,
Cathal

entry.title: Basement Panther: The Quickening
entry.content:
Today so far was pretty good. I actually got up early for the first time this summer, since it's a lot easier now that my bro's home and we can chill in the early morning. He wanted to get a Spain jersey printed so we went into town, I ended up chilling with Darver and Noonan before they waffled their way through English Paper 2, and got a tasty burger, although the quality of Burger King fries has been on the decline this past year, all I'm saying. I split Red Dead Redemption with him too, so far it's pretty good, Ridan and Shootan Coyotes and Cowboyan, apparently it's a long ass game, so I'm looking forward to it, hopefully I won't rack up 150 hours like I did with Final Fantasy X, which was odd cos it isn't like the characters were the most compelling.

There's a Blessing of the Graves I'm going to tonight, and if the weather holds up I might go to Ravensdale for a spot of camping, which for me means walking up and down a mountain listening to Blood on the Tapes all night. I just prefer the acoustic version of Idiot Wind over the one on the final album, although it might be a bit too vicious, but it's probably my favourite Dylan bootleg overall, although Thin Wild Mercury and Supper Club Soundboards are also excellent, the version of Ring Them Bells at the Supper Club is just mind-blowing, a lot of the Oh Mercy songs sound great live actually, much better than the album, which is dragged down by the production, all mysterious bayou ambience, only really suits Man in the Long Black Coat.

I got the new Eminem album too, it's solid, although the first 4 tracks belong on the cutting room floor, you could make a fantastic album to rival Marshall Mathers by combining the best tracks from Recovery and Relapse and Refill, similar to how you could make the mythical Good Post-Illmatic Nas Album by taking 5 tracks from Stillmatic, 7 from God's Son and 2 from Street's Disciple. I'll do that someday, I'll post the tracklistings on here too.

Other than that I've been cycling at least 10 miles a day, which feels great, and I've been macking heavily on wholegrain bread, beyond delicious, especially the Subway wheat bread, which is incredible. I need to start doing some weights too, to keep it varied, and I'm gonna climb Sliabh Fiadh with Eoghan maybe tomorrow before the World Cup starts, although neither of the Friday matches inspire much interest, I'm far more enthusiastic about USA/England, mainly for Will England Finally Actually Play Well in a World Cup?

I've started reading the paper again too; Kevin Myers has gotten a lot better in the 3 months I was away, not that I regret that I stopped reading it, I'll probably read the local papers too now, with the exception of the Dundalk Leader and the online Examiner, which is a joke, although the writing is of a better standard than the Leader, which I haven't picked up since my uncle was on the cover with his new lambs.

Cathal

entry.title: Crazy pills
entry.content:
Back in the day, when everything was all smooth, making fun of embarrassing musicians and movies was completely non-taboo, it was like Dido is HILARIOUS, Sly Stallone's movies are enjoyably bad, and so on and so forth. But now it's 2010, and when these kind of things come along, nobody makes fun of them or even calls them out on being shit, all you find is apologists talking about how Jedward are just as valid as Arcade Fire, or Robert Christgau giving Soulja Boy's album an A-.

I only noticed this recently though, after a couple of things started happening:
A) Every rock magazine put Hole on the cover, and acted like Courtney Love had talent.
and
B) Almost everyone I know started talking about Blink-182 as some kind of brilliant band on the level of Pink Floyd or Can, artistically unassailable, to the point where Jedward covering that terrible song All the Small Things was some kind of public indecency committed against music.

It was pretty weird, especially since Hole and Blink-182 are basically the rock equivalents of Jim Jones and Drake. Of course you won't find anyone admitting this, which makes point C)

C) People will often place shitty rock music ahead of shitty music of any other genre, or even good music of any other genre.

You've probably heard this. Electronica isn't music because "they don't even play instruments" and hip-hop isn't music because it's "just bitches and hoes" (Squarepusher? Hrvatski? The Roots? Public Enemy?), and any example that disproves their dumb-ass generalization is either not a real example of that type of music, or just further proves how right they are. There aren't really that many people who fall under this anymore, mostly they're either above 20 and failing/dropping out of college, or under 15 and they've just heard Nevermind for the first time. Y'know the type, they compare new albums to Sgt. Peppers a lot, and they probably got really upset when the dude from Slipknot kicked the bucket. They usually have one exception to their genrelizations too, usually Eminem and Daft Punk (although lately, it's becoming the Steve Aoki crew, y'know, the asian dude who does the incredibly lazy remixes) and they talked about how Oxegen this year would be flooded with knackers because they had the gall to book rappers rather than more overrated bands who have nothing to recommend them but their guitarist (Protip: Oxegen's lineups have never actually been that good).

Now I'm probably just ranting like this because I think The Cold Vein was the best album of the decade, but what's with this pretending Sid Vicious is better than Soulja Boy?

Seriously,
Cathal

entry.title: Radio
entry.content:
In 1985, this 17-year old kid from Queens put out a rap album called Radio, on Def Jam. That album was fucking hardcore, it was just absolutely incredible. It had songs like I Can't Live Without My Radio and Rock the Bells, which was so awesome that almost 20 years later they named America's biggest hip-hop festival after it. It's flat out great, but like in 2010, everyone thinks of LL Cool J as the dude from Any Given Sunday or something, do people even know he had a musical career? It's depressing, like he started writing ballads and it was all downhill, which sucks, cos he was one of the best rappers. The same thing would have happened to Buddy Holly if he didn't die though, slowly becoming a 2nd-rate romantic lead and taking emphasis off the music, or more likely he would have been just like Pat Boone, and Weezer would make it big with Harmonica Frank. Of the rappers going right now, Kid Cudi's the most likely to go like LL Cool J, except his debut album wasn't really that good, although Make Her Say is awesome (It was part of that 6 months where it looked like Kanye West had learned how to rap, then he vanished and came back and suddenly he was an awful MC again).

Eminem's on the Jonathan Ross show now too, he has that new album with the great sleeve, and he put out that amazing freestyle which was just like Holy shit. I'll still get the album, but I'm not hugely excited, Kobe? Travis Barker?? Rihanna??? Pink???? It'll probably leak over the next couple of days so I'll put up my thoughts when I hear it. Hopefully it won't be like Encore, great flows but terrible beats. But Encore had Puke, so it can't be worse.

Tremolo,
Cathal
